113010.title: ICT Database Officer - Tonga (voluntary)
113010.summary: Contribute to sustainable development across our region and join the Australian Volunteers Program! We’re looking for a ICT Database Officer who can live and work in Tonga for 12 months.
113010.description:
Contribute to sustainable development across our region and join the Australian Volunteers Program! We’re looking for a ICT Database Officer who can live and work in Tonga for 12 months. 

Australian volunteers are supported with flights, training, insurance, living allowances and more. 

About the role

Office of the Public Service Commission is looking for a ICT Database Officer to join the team for 12 months. This assignment is based in Tonga.

  • Strengthen the work of the Office of the Public Service Commission to develop a digital strategy for streamlining HR workflows and data.
  • Embrace a new culture living and working in Nuku'alofa, Tonga.
  • Share your skills and experience in HR information management and database program management with local colleagues.

Australian Volunteers Program

The Australian Volunteers program mobilises skilled Australians on long and short-term international volunteer assignments.  Volunteers work with individuals, organisations and communities on locally-determined development priorities. The Australian Volunteers Program is an Australian Government initiative. Further information on the Australian Volunteers Program is available at www.australianvolunteers.com. 

Australian volunteers are supported with flights, training, insurance, living allowances and more. 

Don't miss out on this life-changing opportunity, apply today!

For more information on the role and to view the assignment description, click here.

Further enquiries to: Lara Bernardo; LBernardo@avi.org.au, using the subject line: ICT Database Officer enquiry via EthicalJobs.

113002.title: Mid Value Donor Specialist - Amnesty International - Melbourne
113002.summary: Amazing role with Amnesty International who are looking for a Mid Value Donor Specialist to join their growing and innovative team.
113002.description:
• Innovative, exciting organisation
  • Work with autonomy and have an impact on a 3-year strategy
  • Excellent salary

Amazing role with Amnesty International who are looking for a Mid Value Donor Specialist to join their growing and innovative team. Build and develop relationships with Mid-tier donors via highly personal relationship management as well as a broader direct marketing approach.

About the organisation

Amnesty International Australia works both at home and internationally. They work across many areas including Indigenous communities, people seeking asylum, unfair detention, fighting a fare justice system, gender and sexuality and all other wider human rights issues.

Key Responsibilities

    • Develop the overall 3-year strategy, annual plan, budget, processes and supporter journeys for Mid Donors
    • Use of data and segmentation to identify prospects
    • Combine both relationship fundraising and direct marketing techniques to develop the Mid Donor program
    • Deliver tailored supporter journeys
    • Build and develop relationships with Mid-tier donors (who give up to $10,000 annually to Amnesty International Australia)
    • Create and grow a pipeline of prospect Major Donors through direct marketing processes
    • Personalized and impactful stewardship of this group of supporters
    • Work collaboratively with members of the Fundraising team, as well as the Philanthropy Team, to develop an integrated approach to Mid Donor communication
    • Plan and execute the Mid Donor engagement strategy including; events, webinars, video, mail and email and identify new and innovative ways of deepening engagement and soliciting further income
    • Identify, cultivate and steward donors who have the propensity to give at Mid Donor level through tailored supporter journeys, direct marketing techniques and filtering mass communications
    • Work with the team to Design and incorporate direct mail and online communications & appeals into the Mid Donor solicitation strategy
    • Report on key metrics for growth in Mid Donor income, and ensure relevant database/s are maintained to achieve a high standard of relationship management
    • Identify and evaluate new fundraising opportunities through data segmentation, testing and innovation
    • Personally engage with donors and will successfully ‘making the ask’ to solicit large gifts

    Skills & Attributes  

    • Experience managing a pipeline of donors using a direct marketing approach
    • Proven success in donor/customer cultivation and stewardship
    • Proven high level ability to formulate a strategic plan and action plan
    • Demonstrated ability in using data and segmentation to tailor communications and drive response
    • Demonstrated ability in managing direct marketing projects, including the design, personalisation and production of materials
    • Demonstrated ability in creating compelling donor proposals and stories to solicit large gifts
    • Ability to interpret data in order to identity and manage donors
    • Experience in Mid or Major Donor stewardship and cultivation

    Benefits

    • Potential to develop the strategy
    • Innovative and creative team
    • Inspiring charity with a fantastic team culture – great brand
113002.application:
Apply here.

Please apply as soon as possible as applications will be reviewed on an immediate basis. 

If you require further information please contact Rosheen Singh from Beaumont People on Rosheen@beaumontpeople.com.au using the subject line: Mid Value Donor Specialist - Amnesty International - Melbourne enquiry via EthicalJobs or please call 02 9093 4911. 

Beaumont Not for Profit has been contracted to recruit this role. Beaumont NFP is a non-profit service specialising in delivering unparalleled permanent and temporary recruitment solutions to the Not for profit sector on a Not for Profit basis.

112977.title: House Coordinator - Disability Accommodation Services
112977.summary: Exciting leadership opportunity in a new respite facility in South Morang. Join our highly dedicated and motivated Accommodation team.
112977.description:
About genU

genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.

genU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do. 

About the role

An exciting opportunity exists for a Full time House Coordinator in our soon to be opened beautiful new residential respite service. You will join our accommodation team operating from the site at South Morang. Reporting directly to the Operations Manager, you will be responsible for:

  • Development and implementation of appropriate communication strategies within the house for the participants and families who access the service and within the team
  • Implementing programs and activities within the house which build a participant’s capacity, resilience and independent living skills through application of a Person Centred Approach
  • Supervising and leading your team to achieve the best possible outcomes for the participant
  • Providing consistent positive behaviour intervention by implementing each participant’s  unique behaviour support plan or strategy
  • Effectively leading and managing a team of staff including rostering and supervision

About You

  • Minimum Certificate IV in Disability or equivalent
  • Demonstrated ability to lead motivated, professional and ethical team(s)
  • Excellent written skills including a proven ability to write reports and keep accurate records
  • Significant experience delivering services in a residential/respite setting
  • Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills

Benefits & Culture

genU is proud to be an EEO employer. genU supports an inclusive approach in the workplace.

  • Generous hourly rate inclusive of afterhours and weekend penalties
  • Salary Packaging benefits
  • Ongoing training & development – accredited and paid
  • Career development opportunities
  • Employee Assistance Program including a dietician service
  • Paid parental leave for primary carers after 12 months of employment

A full position description is attached below.
112977.application:
All applications must be submitted via the genU Website.

Please ensure that you attach a current resume, cover letter and relevant qualification(s).

For further details on this role, please contact Jenny Porter on (03) 5249 6125.

112935.title: Philanthropy Partner Specialist
112935.summary: This role delivers CA’s Mission through the development and growth of lasting relationships with Major Donors and Supporters within the Catholic community, Catholic business and wider community.
112935.description:
• Use your interpersonal skills to develop relationships with key financial Donors and Supporters for a well-respected charity
  • Rare opening at an International Aid and Development Agency
  • Full-time, permanent role based in Sydney

Our Organisation

Caritas Australia is the Catholic agency for international humanitarian relief and development in Australia. Through effective relationships with the Church, partners and communities in Africa, Asia, the Pacific and Australia, Caritas Australia helps to end poverty, promote justice and uphold dignity. Our programs promote the good of every person and of the whole person, regardless of peoples, religious, political or cultural beliefs. We envisage a world in which children, women and men most vulnerable to extreme poverty and injustice are agents of their own change and architects of their own development.

Your Role

As part of the Fundraising Group, your role will involve:

  • Building and maintaining relationships with our Major Donors
  • Monitoring and analysing our donor base to track and report income
  • Identifying strategic opportunities to grow our donor pipeline, while supporting our existing donors
  • Coordinating regular reports that update and inform Major Donors on the application and impacts of their donations
  • Preparing project proposals for prospective Donors and leadership networks

Your Capabilities

You will thrive as a Philanthropy Partner Specialist if you:

  • Possess highly developed relationship management, stakeholder development, and account management skills and enjoy interacting with a range of personalities
  • Can communicate, both in writing and verbally, with all levels of an organisation in an effective and appropriate way
  • Are proficient in research, and creating proposals and presentations that are persuasive and influential
  • Are experienced with donor/customer databases (preferably Salesforce) for analysis and reporting
  • Have high ethical standards in dealing with sensitive financial and confidential matters

For more information about this role please visit www.caritas.org.au/jobs/positions-vacant and view the full Position Description available below.

Please send your application to jobs@caritas.org.au using the subject line: Philanthropy Partner Specialist application via EthicalJobs by COB Tuesday 10 July 2018.

Applications must specify residency or work visa status and include a CV, Cover Letter and responses to the Selection Criteria set out in the Position Description.

For further information please contact Paul Metcalfe on 02 8306 3454.

Caritas Australia is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. Caritas Australia welcomes and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants for all advertised positions.

Caritas Australia recognises the personal dignity and rights of children towards whom it has a special responsibility and duty of care and respect. The successful candidate will be required to undergo a National Criminal History Record Check and Working with Children Check.

112927.title: Senior Carer Practitioner
112927.summary: St Saviours is seeking a Senior Carer Practitioner who is passionate about improving the lives of vulnerable children and young people.
112927.description:
• Full-time Permanent Position
  • Liverpool, NSW

The core mission of St Saviours (trading under Anglicare NSW South, NSW West & ACT) is to break the cycle of intergenerational poverty for children, young people and families. We have a particular focus on serving vulnerable communities in the ACT and regional, rural NSW.

St Saviours is seeking a Senior Carer Practitioner who is passionate about improving the lives of vulnerable children and young people. This new position is part of the wider team of Senior Carer Practitioners across our foster care services. The Senior Carer Practitioner will play a vital role in making sure children and young people have the opportunity to grow in loving and committed foster families.

The Senior Carer Practitioner will work closely with the Foster Care Team and Carers to support high quality placements for children and young people. The successful person will have current, comprehensive understanding of out of home care services; particular skills in family and foster carer assessments; and the capacity to provide guidance regarding best practice placement planning outcomes for children and young people in foster care.

Tertiary qualifications in social work, psychology or a related discipline are mandatory, as well as a minimum 3 years' experience working with children, young people, their families and carers preferably in out of home care. A valid driver's license is also required.

The salary is negotiable commensurate with experience and qualifications. A minimum commencing salary of $73,171 negotiable plus 9.5% employer superannuation guarantee. Generous salary packaging benefits are available under Anglicare's PBI status. Anglicare also offers other benefits including additional personal leave and paid parental leave.

Applicants will be required to undertake the psychometric profiling instrument - SafeSelectTM. Applicants must obtain a Working With Children clearance through the Office of the Children's Guardian (NSW) and undergo a National Criminal History Check prior to an offer of employment.
112927.application:
The Position Description, including Key Requirements and the Application Form can be obtained from Anglicare's website www.anglicare.com.au/aboutus/careers.

For all enquiries, please contact Rachael Atkinson on (02) 9612 3900 (during business hours)

Applications close COB Monday 9th July 2018.

112900.title: After Hours Family Violence Response Workers - Ballarat
112900.summary: The After Hours Family Violence Response Worker provides a range of support services to women and their children who have experienced family violence.
112900.description:
• Ballarat (Mt Helen) location
  • Multiple fixed-term, part-time positions available until 30 June 2019
  • Generous salary packaging benefits
  • Flexible hours considered for the right person! 

Assist women and their children to remain safely within their community and maintain a life free of violence.

Join Victoria’s largest independent child welfare organisation and become a vital part of a team that never gives up doing whatever it takes for kids. We believe everyone should have a good childhood, growing up in families and communities where they feel safe, nurtured and have hope for the future.

The Western Family Violence service provides a range of support services to women and their children who have experienced family violence. The service aims to assist women and their children to remain safely within their community and maintain a life free of violence while also addressing the emotional and practical needs and issues arising from the violence. 

The After Hours Family Violence Response Worker works directly with women and children, assisting them to identify their own needs and strengths, support women with identified barriers and where appropriate, to function as an advocate in an after-hours and weekend roster role.

We have multiple part time positions available that will cover a variety of functions including: responding to Safe Steps, Police and other referrals via participating in Intake, providing a range of response interventions which are identified through Risk Assessment and increasing the safety of the Women and children the service responds to. The role will also carry a case work function, and the worker will also participate in an After-Hours on-call roster.

About you:

  • You will have a tertiary qualification in Social Work, Psychology, welfare or a related discipline as well as a full driver’s licence.
  • You will have a proven ability to provide case management and direct support, assistance and advocacy for clients who have experienced trauma.
  • You will be able to work autonomously with strong organisational skills.
  • You will have a demonstrated understanding of issues, policy and legislation relating to family violence.

Flexible working hours will be considered for the right person - please contact Nicole McCarty prior to applying if you wish to discuss your ideal roster.

To download the Position Description, please click here.

To download the Key Selection Criteria, please click here.

Berry Street are committed to the safety, participation and empowerment of all children, including those with a disability and culturally and/or linguistically diverse backgrounds. Berry Street are also committed to cultural safety, inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families and communities. Comprehensive reference and background checking will be undertaken, including a Working with Children Check and police check. Aboriginal people; people from culturally and/or linguistically diverse backgrounds and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.

112856.title: Complex Care Clinician - Allied Health - Wodonga / Wangaratta
112856.summary: Help people to gain better mental health, and improve the quality of their lives. We are seeking an outstanding Complex Care Clinician to join the Mind Centre for Mental Health & Wellbeing.
112856.description:
• Complex Care Clinician – Allied Health
  • Work full time, 38 hours per week on a 12 month contract
  • Wodonga/Wangaratta, Regional Victoria Location

Help people to gain better mental health, and improve the quality of their lives.

Mind is seeking to appoint an outstanding Complex Care Clinician – Allied Health to join the Mind Centre for Mental Health and Wellbeing, Wodonga and Wangaratta.

The primary purpose of this role is to provide quality allied health discipline specific and transdisciplinary clinical services to customers with mental ill health or dual disabilities; who have complex care needs. The Complex Care Clinician will provide clinical assessment and interventions including clinical behaviour support and capacity building for customers with complex needs.

The role also provides expert consultation and clinical behaviour intervention service for customers with complex needs as well as their families/carers, other clinicians and support services/staff working with people with mental ill health or dual disabilities who have complex support needs and who may display behaviours of concern.

In this role you will:

  • Work full time, 38 hours per week on a 12 month contract
  • Strive to improve the quality of life of our customers through evidence based innovative practice, with a track record of clinical practice and results
  • Possess highly developed clinical skills relevant to your allied health discipline coupled with the ability to operate within complex and changing environments
  • Have clinical and allied health experience in mental health and disability services
  • Have Tertiary qualifications and appropriate registration within Clinical Psychology, Psychology, Psychiatric Nursing, Occupational Therapy, Social Work or other related fields as designated by Mind. Professional Registration is required.

A full position description is attached below.

112837.title: Aboriginal Family Led Decision Making Convenor
112837.summary: If you like to be part of an organisation that strives in strengthening the safety, wellbeing and cultural connectedness of Aboriginal children, individuals and families, we want to hear from you.
112837.description:
• Full time position
  • Melton office
  • Competitive remuneration package with salary packaging

The Opportunity

The Aboriginal Family Led Decision Making (AFLDM) program is based on traditional family values where the responsibility for bringing up children is shared by parents together with extended family and community and guided by the wisdom and experience of elders.

AFLDM encourages family members, extended family, Elders, Significant others in the child's life and where appropriate the child and/or young person, to meet and make decisions about the safety and wellbeing of children and/or young people who are involved in the Child Protection system.

About Us

Victorian Aboriginal Child Care Agency (VACCA) operates within the context that Aboriginal children continue to be significantly over-represented in the protection and care system within Victoria. VACCA considers that it has the responsibility and the opportunity to promote, advocate for and achieve positive changes in the lives of Aboriginal children, their families and the broader Aboriginal community.

If you like to be part of an organisation that strives in strengthening the safety and wellbeing and cultural connectedness of Aboriginal children, individuals and families in their community, we want to hear from you.

To be considered for this role you must demonstrate:

  • Awareness and appreciation of Aboriginal societies and cultures and an understanding of the issues affecting Aboriginal people in contemporary Australia and the diversity of circumstances of Aboriginal people.
  • Ability to effectively communicate with Aboriginal people.
  • A proven ability to advocate on behalf of children and families.

Please note: This is an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander designated position, classified under Section 12 Special Measures of the Equal Opportunity Act 2010. This employment opportunity is only available to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
112837.application:
For a copy of the position description and to apply for this position, click here www.vacca.recruitmenthub.com.au/Vacancies.

Application deadline is Sunday 8th July 2018.

For more information regarding your exciting future with VACCA, please contact Brenda Young on 9287 8800

112830.title: Direct Marketing Coordinator
112830.summary: In this varied & rewarding role,  you will assist with the implementation of the Individual Giving Program utilising direct marketing strategies & tactics across a variety of platforms.
112830.description:
Job No: ASPECT743

Location: Frenchs Forest, NSW

  • Exciting opportunity to develop or begin your career in fundraising
  • Australia’s leading charity provider of autism services
  • Full time, permanent role within a dynamic fundraising team
  • Competitive remuneration package based on qualifications & experience
  • Excellent, tax effective PBI salary packaging benefits
  • Based in Frenchs Forest - Sydney's Northern Beaches, NSW 

What we do: 

Autism Spectrum Australia (Aspect) is Australia’s largest specialist autism provider, delivering services to people nationwide. Aspect provides a range of centre and community based services, focussing on education services, early intervention, skills development, community engagement, and self-directed options for people with autism and other disabilities.

About the role: 

In this varied & rewarding role, you will assist with the implementation of the Individual Giving Program utilising direct marketing strategies & tactics across a variety of platforms. You will also be responsible for delivering outstanding customer service to develop & maintain relationships with supporters to fuel retention & income growth.

About you:

We are looking for someone who is a people person & a creative thinker, ideally with experience in a similar role, but if you think you have relevant transferrable skills, we will certainly consider your application.

You will need exceptional planning, project coordination & time management skills to meet multiple deadlines, together with strong written & verbal communication skills enabling you to deliver outstanding customer service. If you think your experience matches our requirements, we encourage you to apply.

 Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist with the implementation of the Individual Giving Program utilising direct marketing strategies to engage existing supporters & to acquire new supporters & income growth
  • Research & coordinate the development of creative content for campaigns & activities across direct mail, telemarketing, email, digital & social channels
  • Implement the supporter relationship management strategy to ensure all supporters receive a seamless & rewarding experience
  • Work closely with suppliers including agencies, consultants, designers, copywriters, printers & mail houses, as well as internal stakeholders
  • Assist with monitoring, reporting & analysis of campaigns to identify trends & opportunities
  • Undertake administrative duties & ensure accurate maintenance of database records
  • Provide excellent customer service

Skills, experience & qualifications:

  • 1-2 years’ experience in fundraising, direct marketing, marketing, communications or project coordination role
  • Excellent time management skills & the ability to multi-task
  • Exceptional written & verbal communication skills
  • Ability to effectively build & manage relationships with a wide range of stakeholders
  • Effective database & analytical skills
  • Proven ability to work as part of a team
  • Strong MS Office skills, particularly in Word, Excel & Outlook
  • Outstanding customer service skills

This position also requires a Police Check, which Aspect will arrange.

What we offer: 

A competitive package will be based on relevant qualifications & experience. As a Public Benevolent Institution (PBI), Aspect employees receive tax-effective salary packaging opportunities including $15,899 each year tax free. This means you can increase the value of your take-home pay. Click here for a summary of some of the benefits you can access when working at Aspect.

For more information about Aspect: www.autismspectrum.org.au.

Please include your resume & complete the candidate questionnaire as part of Aspect's online recruitment process. 

Enquiries should be directed to: Vanessa Byrne, National Manager, Fundraising on (02) 8977 8346.

Click here to view the Position Profile.

Please submit applications as soon as possible.

Aspect is a Public Benevolent Institution and EEO employer.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

112784.title: Psychologist - Disability Service Australia
112784.summary: New Psychologist role joining a supportive and experienced clinical team within a Not For Profit. Located in Bankstown, Mascot or Campbelltown, Sydney.
112784.description:
• $100K package + $13k car allowance
  • Receive regular supervision with opportunity to professionally develop your skills

Beaumont People are excited to be working with DSA, Disability Service Australia in the search for a Registered Psychologist to work as part of a small and highly skilled clinical team.

About you

You will be a motivated Psychologist with a high level of personal and professional integrity, who is driven to supporting vulnerable members of the community

Work as part of a passionate and supportive team where you will contribute to making a different in the lives of those with complex issues. Work for an organisation committed to providing career advancement opportunities, DSA are passionate about providing training and development which can lead to a great career.

112751.title: Resource Worker - Regional Family Violence Partnership
112751.summary: An exciting opportunity for an experienced Resource Worker to bring a sense of curiosity, innovation and advocacy in the delivery and implementation of projects which address family violence.
112751.description:
Eastern Domestic Violence Services (EDVOS) is a not-for-profit specialist family violence service in Melbourne’s eastern metropolitan region. We provide an integrated range of support and services to empower women and children who are responding to family violence. We operate within a human rights framework and our focus is on supporting the safety of women and children and the accountability of perpetrators. EDVOS is a member and the auspice agency of the Regional Family Violence Partnership (RFVP). RFVP is a partnership of organisations committed to working together to address family violence in the Inner and Outer Eastern Department of Health and Human Services areas. The goal of the RFVP is to build a system to support women and children's safety and hold perpetrators of family violence accountable for their behaviour. RFVP brings together representation from the human services, health and justice sectors.

The Resource Worker position is a fixed term, part-time opportunity (0.6FTE) until June 2019.

About the Opportunity                                 

The Resource Worker will support the Principal Strategic Advisor in the delivery of an effective regional integration strategy and action plan, while ensuring the involvement of the RFVP in the fast-paced reforms arising from the Royal Commission into Family Violence (RCFV) implementation outcomes and opportunities. This is an exciting role that requires curiosity, innovation and advocacy, with opportunities for influencing and shaping the role. The resource worker will support the delivery and implementation of distinct projects approved by the RFVP Executive Committee and research and critically analyse various reform matters and draft submission responses to government on behalf of the RFVP. There may also be an opportunity to represent the RFVP at regional and state-wide fora as required and to provide support at RFVP events. The Resource Worker will work in conjunction with the Principal Strategic Advisor to meet all planned outcomes of the 3-year RFVP plan and its annual action plans.

Essential to your success will be:

  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline (e.g. Social Sciences)
  • Demonstrate experience and skills in project management
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of family violence issues, government policy and initiatives and the family violence sector.
  • Demonstrated experience in the not-for-profit/ community services sector
  • Highly developed written and verbal communication skills with excellent report writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with a broad range of stakeholders.
  • Strong relationship and partnership building skills.
  • Demonstrated high-level competency with the Microsoft Office suite of programs, including Excel.
  • Exceptional time management skills with the ability to prioritise workload whilst maintaining strong attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated conceptual, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proven ability to function both independently and within a team environment

What We Offer

  • Generous salary packaging benefits resulting in tax savings
  • Excellent Professional Development opportunities including external training and workshops as well as EDVOS all staff training
  • Health and wellbeing programs for all staff including weekly yoga classes, walk at work, bi-monthly staff shared lunch and birthday calendar
  • Regular supervision and management support including access to EAP

112725.description:
The Tenancy Support Program aims to improve housing outcomes for persons living with mental health issues. The Tenancy Support Worker will work with individuals and families who are homeless to aid them access suitable housing and assist those who are having problems with their accommodation, whether in private or public rental.

MHACA (Mental Health Association of Central Australia) is a non-government, community based organisation and a specialist in providing quality mental health services in Central Australia. It offers supportive work conditions and salary sacrificing.

To be successful for this position you will need:

  • Qualifications and/or extensive experience in mental health, tenancy support, housing or related fields.
  • Experience in basic case management or counselling.
  • Have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

112710.summary: The Senior Practitioner / Senior Case Manager is accountable to the Supervisor for enhancing Social Worker/Case Manager capacity by fostering good working and reporting relationships.

The Senior Practitioner/Senior Case Manager is accountable to the Supervisor for:

112702.title: Financial Counsellor - Ngaanyatjarra Lands
112702.summary: Mani-Ku Ninti (Money Smart) is the Ngaanyatjarra Council Financial Wellbeing and Capability Program providing financial literacy education, counselling and support to the Ngaanyatjarra communities.
112702.description:
• Permanent Full Time
  • Salary Range $70 000 - $80 000 plus 9.5% Super and 17.5% Leave Loading on 4 weeks annual leave;
  • Total of 8 weeks leave per year;
  • Full PBI Salary Packaging;
  • Vehicle for work purposes, accommodation and all utilities.

Ngaanyatjarra Council (AC) is a dynamic Aboriginal organisation representing the interests of approx. 2000 Ngaanyatjarra, Pintupi & Pitjantjatjara people living in eleven Communities in the Central Desert region of Western Australia.

Mani-Ku Ninti (Money Smart) is the Ngaanyatjarra Council Financial Wellbeing and Capability Program providing financial literacy education, counselling and support to the Ngaanyatjarra communities.

We are looking for an experienced Financial Counsellor to join our small team. Applicants must be appropriately qualified with a minimum of a Diploma of Community Work (Financial Counselling) and be accredited with FCA.  We are seeking someone who can demonstrate significant Financial Counselling services and experience at Social & Community Work Level 5 or equivalent.

Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Work within a team consisting of two Financial Counsellors and community based Financial Capability Workers;
  • Case management and support for individuals, families and community groups;
  • Assessment and referral of clients to alternative agencies or support services to assist them with issues impacting on their financial management;
  • Developing and delivering community education and information sessions on a range of financial management topics;
  • Assisting with the coordination and compilation of basic reports against KPI’s.

This position is based on the Ngaanyatjarra Lands and requires extensive travel on unsealed roads. You must be willing and able to drive a 4wd over long distances and do basic maintenance and repairs as required - i.e. change a flat tyre. Previous experience living in remote indigenous communities or other cross-cultural experience will be highly regarded.

You will require a current ‘C’ class drivers licence as well as a National Police Check & WA Working with Children check and pre-employment medical.

A full position description is available below.

112658.title: Legal Practice Manager - Principal Lawyer
112658.summary: The Legal Practice Manager is responsible for all aspects of the legal practice and management of a team of community and specialist lawyers providing a range of community legal services to clients.
112658.description:
The Northern Community Legal Centre (NCLC) is a not-for-profit community legal centre which operates in one of the fastest growing areas of Melbourne, and has a significant catchment including the Moreland, Hume and Mitchell Shire Local Government Areas. The NCLC operates from a central office located in Broadmeadows with outreach clinics to other service areas.

NCLC seeks to make our services accessible to all the community by providing legal advice, education and referrals. However, NCLC recognises that there are members of our community who suffer serious disadvantage. To this end NCLC has prioritized the following groups, which have the least resources and ability to access legal assistance; newly arrived and refugees; survivors/victims of family violence, young people, people with mental health issues, and elderly people suffering abuse and have aligned our service delivery accordingly.

The Legal Practice Manager (Principal Lawyer) is responsible for providing leadership, management and oversight across the Legal Services, the legal practice and a number of key projects. The Legal Practice Manager also manages and leads policy initiatives, law reform and strategic advocacy. As a recently formed, and dynamic organisation working in highly diverse community the LPM will engage with key partners and services across the North Western region. This position is a key leader across the organisation with two other Managers (Community Development and Administration) and the Chief Executive Officer (CEO). The position is responsible for all aspects of the legal practice and the management of a team of currently 7 community and specialist lawyers providing a range of community legal services to clients. The focus of the position is on developing and managing the legal practice and providing support and supervision to the legal staff and legal volunteers as well as being a key identifier of systemic legal issues and innovative responses.

A full position description is available below.
112658.application:
Applicants are required to submit a resume and covering letter addressing the key selection criteria to jsmith@northernclc.org.au, using the subject line: Legal Practice Manager application via EthicalJobs. Applications that do not address the key selection criteria will not be considered.

For more information call Jenni Smith, CEO on 03 9310 4376.

112656.title: Occupational Therapist
112656.summary: We're searching for an enthusiastic Grade 1 or 2 Occupational Therapist to join our highly regarded, Not For Profit, Aged Care organisation located in Doncaster.
112656.description:
We're searching for an enthusiastic Grade 1 or 2 Occupational Therapist to join our highly regarded, Not For Profit, Aged Care organisation located in Doncaster on a Part Time basis.

MannaCare is a community based not-for-profit organisation which supports older people living in the Eastern region. MannaCare provides and maintains a range of services, including Residential Aged Care and Community Care. Our Community Care services encompass Home Care Packages, MCA FlexiCare, Home Maintenance Service, Community Respite & Social Support, and Rehabilitation (DRS) & GymActive.

Doncaster Rehabilitation Services (DRS) provides allied health and therapy services that assist older people to regain or maintain physical, functional and cognitive abilities, thereby facilitating them to remain living in the community. Services include physiotherapy, exercise physiology, occupational therapy and podiatry.

Due to growth in the community services area, we have a fantastic opportunity for an enthusiastic and motivated Grade 1 or Grade 2 Occupational Therapist (OT) to join our DRS Service area, on a part time basis, working approximately 32 hours per fortnight.

The successful candidate/s will possess the following:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Occupational Therapy and current AHPRA practicing certificate
  • Demonstrated high level knowledge and interest in Aged Care
  • Meet all legislative requirements within the Aged Care industry
  • Strong organisational, time management and communication skills
  • Ability to work with a diverse range of clients, with a focus on holistic, client-centred practice and quality control
  • Current and clear police check or willingness to attain one
  • Current Victorian Driver's licence
  • Experience within Aged Care desired, but new graduates encouraged to apply

In return, we will provide you with:

  • Competitive rate of pay
  • Flexible hours
  • Supportive and collaborative work
  • Ongoing training
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Discounted movie tickets
  • Salary packaging (if eligible)

For more information about the role, please contact Dharani Nagarajan on 9856 1292, or to view the Position Description, please check out our website: www.mannacare.org.au.

If you're an enthusiastic and energetic OT who loves to make a difference in the lives of older people in the community, and this sounds like a role you would be interested in, don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity - please apply now!
112656.application: To apply for this job go to: www.mcai.recruitmenthub.com.au and enter reference code: 4219895.

112636.title: Youth Services Team Leaders x2 - Galiwinku / Ramingining
112636.summary: Shape positive outcomes in this new youth focused service. Two positions on offer for those with exceptional leadership, training and mentoring skills.
112636.description:
• Galiwinku & Ramingining based
  • Shape positive outcomes
  • New youth focused service
  • Two positions on offer for those with exceptional leadership, training and mentoring skills

About the opportunity:

ALPA is in the process of launching a new youth focused service in East Arnhem Land and are currently accepting applications for two Team Leader positions to join our Youth Services department.

We are seeking committed and driven individuals who are able to work in a team environment to successfully understand and motivate young people. These exciting vacancies are based in the communities of Galiwin'ku & Ramingining in East Arnhem Land.

The ALPA Youth Services team will focus on providing early intervention and ongoing support services to vulnerable young people and strengthening their relationships with their families and community support networks through our Youth Development Program.

The Youth Development Program aims to deliver four key outcomes, being that young people:

  • Develop the skills to maintain positive and healthy relationships
  • Build confidence and resilience
  • Increase their awareness around mental and physical wellbeing
  • Participation in volunteering, education, training and/or employment

The Youth Services Team Leader will be responsible for the leadership, training and mentoring of a team of Yolngu Youth Support Officers in their community. The Youth Development Program will be Yolngu led and have a strong focus on meaningful consultation, traditional cultural and law frameworks, maintaining healthy and loving relationships in community, helping participants engage in education / training / employment, developing leadership skills and building resilience & confidence.

Keys to your success will be:

  • Knowledge, experience and a clear track record of success in running youth specific programs.
  • Certificate IV or Diploma in Youth Work or Community Services is required
  • Experience working with, or demonstrated understanding of the needs of young people at risk
  • Experience in providing leadership/ mentoring to adolescents
  • Ability to work independent and successfully facilitate effective teamwork

If you think you are the right person to take on this exciting role but have some questions or aren't sure if you have enough experience in working in a remote environment or an Indigenous cultural context please don't hesitate to get in touch with us and have a chat. ALPA are the largest Indigenous corporation in Australia and have been operating in these communities for over 40 years, we are great at supporting incoming team members to successfully transition their careers to live a fulfilling life and achieve incredible outcomes as a part of our team in East Arnhem Land.

Are you our next Youth Services Team Leader?
112636.application:
To apply for this job go to www.alpa.asn.au/current-jobs and enter reference code: 4219001.

Applications close 08 July 2018.

To find out more please contact Monika Kaul Guha (HR Business Partner) at recruitment@alpa.asn.au using the subject line: Youth Services Team Leaders enquiry via EthicalJobs.

Your application should include a covering letter that details your relevant skills and experience (maximum two pages) and an up-to-date resume of no more than five pages.

All applications will be treated confidentially.

112599.title: Clinical Nurse Consultant
112599.summary: We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice. We are seeking a Clinical Nurse Consultant to join our Organisation!
112599.description:
About Us

At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place.  We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.

Our services are in the areas of aged care and disability, community services, and chaplaincy and we get involved in social justice and advocacy issues that impact the people we serve.

As an organisation we celebrate our diversity and welcome all people regardless of lifestyle choices, ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identify.

We are bold, imaginative, respectful and compassionate.

About the opportunity

When passionate people come together, they can make a real difference in the lives of others. That’s why, we’re looking for a Clinical Nurse Consultant.

This role is responsible for guiding the process of clinical practice improvement in the area of Wounds care, ensuring clinical practices are research based, innovative and up-to-date, leading clinical service delivery and consultancy strategy and contributing to service-related professional development, to ensure Uniting delivers market leading clinical services.

You will: 

  • Provide expert clinical advice on Wounds care to patients, carers and healthcare providers
  • Lead the development of clinical practices in the area of Wounds care
  • Initiate and distribute the findings of research into Wounds and care models for this condition
  • Contribute to development and delivery of Wounds care related education programs
  • Support the development and implementation of clinical practice models and polices for the area of Wounds care and assist in their implementation in services.

About you

You are an exceptional team player with a high level of energy and enthusiasm that thrives on helping others.  

You will also have:

  • Current registration with APHRA as a register nurse
  • Master’s Degree in Wounds care or related Aged Care field
  • Significant clinical leadership experience in Wounds or aged care for a minimum of 3 years
  • Strong leadership skills focused on mentoring and coaching others to lead clinical care best practice
  • Familiar with legislative requirements for the human services/not-for-profit/aged care industry
  • Experience in report writing and documentation skills
  • Willingness to travel

Benefits & culture

Uniting is proud to be an EEO employer. Uniting supports an inclusive approach in the workplace. We celebrate our diversity and welcome staff regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. 

  • Salary packaging for permanent employees
  • Paid travel entitlement
  • Ongoing training & development
  • Career development opportunities

Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which may include a National Police Check and Reference Checks.
112599.application:
Click on the following link to apply: https://unitingcareers.nga.net.au. 

If you have any queries, please feel free to contact Chloe Bamber via email cbamber@uniting.org using the subject line: Clinical Nurse Consultant - Sydney enquiry via EthicalJobs for follow-up information.

113487.title: AOD Clinician - Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation - Shepparton
113487.summary: SalvoCare Northern Victoria is seeking to employ a suitably qualified and experienced person to undertake a position within the Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation Team based in Shepparton.
113487.description:
Want a fantastic opportunity to join an enthusiastic team of skilled professionals that is making a difference in people’s lives in Shepparton? Then SalvoCare Northern is interested in working with you!

SalvoCare Northern Victoria is seeking to employ a suitably qualified and experienced person to undertake a position within the Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation Team based in Shepparton.

The position sits with in the Goulburn Valley Alcohol & Drugs Services - which is a consortium of made up of Goulburn Valley Health (Lead), SalvoCare Northern & Odyssey House Victoria offering Counselling, Care & Recovery, Non Residential Withdrawal and Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation Services for people who reside in the Goulburn Valley & Lower Hume Regions.

The Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation Program has been funded by the Victorian Government and the program provides an intensive 10 week, holistic treatment service, including pre entry and aftercare support.

The day program incorporates cognitive therapy, behavioural structures and case planning, within a safe environment, enhancing individual motivation for change and skills development. The key aims of the program are to:

  • Reduce or cease harmful alcohol and other drug use, and to avoid and better manage relapse
  • Establish healthier relationships and lifestyles free of problematic alcohol and drug use

We are seeking a full time Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation Clinician. The role would be an exciting opportunity for an experienced AOD or related sector clinician who possessed the relevant health or welfare tertiary qualifications in addition to possessing group and case management skills. This position operates Monday to Friday during business hours and provides training and development opportunities. Successful applicants will have a current, valid Victorian driver’s licence.

Remuneration as determined within the Social, Community, Home Care & Disability Services Industry Award 2010 and the National Employment Standards. Pay point dependant on experience.

SalvoCare Northern offers generous salary packaging and flexible working arrangements.

A full position description is available below.
113487.application:
If this sounds like the employment opportunity for you or you would like to discuss further, please contact Juanita Davis, Manager of AOD Services on 0428 045 004.

Please send applications, including a CV and covering letter addressing the specialist job competencies as in the position description to Therese.McRae@aus.salvationarmy.org, using the subject line: AOD Clinician - Therapeutic Day Rehabilitation - Shepparton application via EthicalJobs, by 4.00pm Tuesday 17 July 2018. Only applications sent to this email address will be considered.

113401.title: Caring Dads Child & Family Wellbeing Coordinator
113401.summary: Caring Dads is an early intervention program for fathers who have abused or neglected their children. Be responsible for the case coordination of the safety and well-being needs for participants.
113401.description:
• Part Time .6 EFT
  • Fixed Term - 12 months
  • Heidelberg Location
  • Generous salary packaging

The Caring Dads program is jointly provided by CPS and UnitingCare ReGen in collaboration with the University of Toronto and University of Melbourne. Caring Dads is an early intervention program developed in Canada by the University of Toronto and Changing Ways, for fathers who have physically abused, emotionally abused or neglected their children, or exposed their children to domestic violence or who are deemed to be at high-risk for these behaviours.

The Child & Family Wellbeing Coordinator position will be responsible for the case coordination of the safety and well-being needs for children and family of the program participants. This all-of-family approach scaffolds and supports the behaviour change in the Caring Dads program. As the foundation of this program is to increase women and children's safety, this role is responsible for the continual monitoring of all family members safety.

They will work closely with the Caring Dads Clinical Group Facilitators to collaborate with relevant services the clients may be engaged with, and participate in supervision, program evaluation and reporting as required.

The successful candidate will have a broad knowledge of both specialist and mainstream services particularly the Family Violence system and Child Protection system and have extensive experience in undertaking risk assessments and demonstrated understanding of working with complex family dynamics and varying family therapy models would also be highly regarded.

Relevant tertiary qualifications in Social Work, Psychology, Community Services, Counselling, Casework Practice or a related field, with eligibility for membership with relevant professional body required. Family Violence training (eg CRAF) is highly desirable.

You will be rewarded with a collaborative and outcomes focussed culture, career and professional development, work flexibility, staff wellbeing program, and an attractive salary including the opportunity to salary package to increase take home pay.
113401.application:
To apply for this job go to: cps.recruitmenthub.com.au and enter reference code: 4229987.

Applications stating the Position Title, must address the Key Selection Criteria and list two professional referees. Further information and position description are available at www.cps.org.au

Please direct enquiries to Monique Yeoman, Statewide Coordinator of Caring Dads either by phone on 9450 0900 or via email at myeoman@cps.org.au using the subject line: Caring Dads Child and Family Wellbeing Coordinator enquiry via EthicalJobs.

Applications close, Monday 16th July 2018, 5pm.

113346.title: Occupational Therapist - Cairns
113346.summary: We are looking for an experienced Occupational Therapist to join the Act for Kids team in our Cairns office. This position is part-time 0.6FTE; fixed-term until 30 September 2021.
113346.description:
About us...

Act for Kids is a prominent provider of free prevention, professional therapy and support services for children who have suffered abuse and support for families at risk. With over 25 centres nationally, we have supported thousands of children and their families for 30 years. In 2016 - 2017 we helped over 34,324 Australians; a 58% increase from the year before.

Our unique multidisciplinary teams provide integrated therapy, sexual abuse counselling, safe houses in remote Indigenous communities, information, advice and referral services, intensive family support and early learning centres designed for children with additional development needs to ensure we set them up for success at school.

About the job.....

We are looking for an experienced Occupational Therapist to join the Act for Kids team in our Cairns office. This position is part-time 0.6FTE; fixed-term until 30 September 2021. 

Responsibilities:

  • Providing an outstanding therapeutic service to children, young people and their families within the Intensive Family Support Program.
  • Encouraging and strengthening supportive relationships with adult caregivers.
  • Enhancing psychosocial outcomes for children impacted by trauma.
  • Working with other professionals and agencies to enhance client outcomes.

See the full position description visit: https://www.actforkids.com.au/careers/position-available/.

About you....

  • A tertiary qualification in occupational therapy.
  • Registration with the Occupational Therapy Board of Australia.
  • Experience working with children, young people and their families with complex needs is desirable.
  • Experience facilitating group programs is desirable.
  • Ability to rapidly acquire an understanding of relevant child protection legislation and policy reforms.
  • Clinical and therapeutic understanding of the impacts of trauma on child and family functioning and knowledge of current trauma treatment trends.

With over 30% of our employees identifying as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, we encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

About the pay...

This position is classified Level 6 under the SCHCADS award. The salary range is $80,676 - $83,173 per annum (above award, pro-rata for part-time) plus 9.5% superannuation. In addition, Act for Kids has an excellent salary packaging program, which offers team members the opportunity to significantly increase their take home pay. 

Joining a strong values based organisation you will have access to benefits such as:

  • Professional Development
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Study Leave
  • Paid Parental Leave

A full position description is available below.
113346.application:
To apply, please visit our website: https://www.actforkids.com.au/careers/position-available/.

Contact Britt Sherwell for more information about the role on 07 4033 8500 or britts@actforkids.com.au, using the subject line: Occupational Therapist - Cairns enquiry via EthicalJobs.

110556.title: Chief Executive Officer - Twilight Aged Care
110556.summary: As CEO you will lead this highly respected boutique aged care provider on Sydney’s North Shore.
110556.description:
• Highly respected boutique aged care provider on Sydney’s North Shore
  • 100 years of history, 4 homes and 1 in development, 160 staff and 160 residents
  • Suited to candidates with property, finance & business building skills

 The Organisation

Twilight Aged Care is well known in the community for creating uniquely intimate environments in each of their four aged care homes based in the northern suburbs. This nurturing, welcoming atmosphere is reflected in the way the 160 employees deliver care and compassion to each resident.

With over 100 years of experience, Twilight provides high quality residential aged care for more than 160 men and women with increasingly high care needs. Crucially, Twilight always enables its residents to maintain independence, individuality, dignity and quality of life in a safe and supportive environment.

Each of the Twilight homes have been designed to create a positive, uplifting environment for residents comprising ‘home-like’ indoor dining and common areas, recreational spaces for residents to participate in group activities, wholistic health, lifestyle and wellbeing programs.

Significant investment continues to improve the homes in line with a strategic priority to enhance facilities.

The Role

Reporting to the board your role as CEO will be to shape the future of Twilight Aged Care in a dynamic aged care industry. You will focus the organisation, identify opportunities for growth, develop the asset base and drive achievement of its mission and purpose. The key areas of responsibility will be;

  • Providing vision, inspiration and leadership to a passionate team
  • Developing and implementing strategic and business plans
  • Diversifying income with a focus on opportunities to lift service income
  • Commercial and financial performance of the business
  • Sales, public relations, branding and marketing
  • Exceptional understanding of residents’ and workforce needs
  • Working with the board to build governance capacity and performance
  • Leading the focus on enhancement or expansion of premises

Skills Required

You are a visionary senior executive or CEO with the passion and experience to lead this celebrated organisation to the next stage of its development. Your successful commercial approach to running businesses including asset management, acquisition and business partnerships combined with a strong understanding of fee for service and government funding will be key.

Ideally you have substantial experience in leading an aged care organisation with a detailed understanding of the specific sources of funding, the aged care reform process and knowledge of the needs and issues faced by ageing Australians.

The successful candidate will also have;

  • Strong advocacy, networking and partnership building skills with demonstrated capacity to work effectively with community groups, suppliers, quality standards agencies and contractors
  • Excellent financial, people and communication skills with the ability to thrive in a changing environment
  • A track record in sales and marketing including public relations and branding
110556.application: If you’re passionate about growing businesses and the future of aged care in Australia please click here to apply and send your cover letter responding to the skills required above and resume in MS Word format, quoting reference #34337 or call Richard Green on 02 8243 0570 to discuss.

111276.title: Fitzroy Valley Youth Engagement Strategy Consultant - Broome
111276.summary: Garnduwa in partnership with Fitzroy Valley Futures Forum, seek Expressions of Interest from experienced consultants in the collation of a Fitzroy Valley Youth Engagement Strategy.
111276.description:
The Fitzroy Valley Futures forum is community lead collaboration initiative of local government, service providers, residents and interested party stakeholders.  The forum seeks to deliver strong and appropriate outcomes in the Valley to address gaps in participation and opportunity faced in regional/remote WA.   

As an active collaborator to the forum, Garnduwa is an Aboriginal Corporation who has actively delivered services to the remote regions of the Kimberley for over 25 years.

Expressions of Interest are now sought for an experienced consultant to research and collate the Fitzroy Valley Youth Engagement Strategy. 

The Strategy aims to:

  • identify barriers faced to engagement (education, employment, training) by the local youth cohort.
  • identify potential solutions to close gaps in service and reduce identified barriers to engagement.
  • identify local capacity to respond to these barriers (service and infrastructure)

A demonstrated ability to work in and alongside Aboriginal communities is an essential requirement of this role.
111276.application:
With consideration of the attached Terms of Reference- please email EOI's (including your CV and relevant supporting information and quotation) to: Erica Sykes, coordinator@fvf.org.au, using the subject line: Fitzroy Valley Youth Engagement Strategy Consultant application via EthicalJobs.

Applications Close: This campaign will close at 5pm (AWST) on Monday the 9th of July 2018.

111250.organisation_name: Key Assets - The Children's Services Provider
111250.title: Team Manager - Foster Care
111250.summary: The Team Manager will take a leadership role in the team, provide appropriate levels of management, supervision, support & training to Social Workers to ensure that high quality practice is achieved.
111250.description:
Key Assets The Children’s Services Provider

  • An evolving Out of Home Care service (NGO) provider, located in New Zealand's North and South islands and Australia wide
  • Committed to building a culturally diverse and inclusive workforce, AWEI Bronze Employer of Choice for 2015 & 2016, AWEI Gold Employer Award for 2017, AWEI Silver Employer Award for 2018, finalist for the Australian HR Awards 2017 and Top 3 Finalist in the Diversity Awards NZ for Cultural Celebrations
  • We provide therapeutic practice support to families and the vulnerable children and young people placed in their care
  • Full time (37.5 hours, some flexibity may be required with travel within the community), office based in Clayton, VIC

Key Assets – The Children's Services Provider is a dynamic Not-For-Profit community service organisation providing high quality, innovative out of home family and community based placements for children and young people with varying needs and behaviours. Since 2007 our unique service has grown respect across 6 states within Australia and within the North and South Islands of New Zealand. 

We are now seeking a dynamic and creative individual to be a Team Manager within the Key Assets Social Work Service in our Victoria office.

About the role:

As the Team Manager you will take a leadership role in the team and provide appropriate levels of line management, supervision, support and training to Social Workers to ensure that high quality practice is an achievable aim for all Social Workers in line with Key Assets and the group’s Vision and Values

Key Components of the role

  • To take a high profile and leadership role in the staff structure and provide appropriate levels of line management, supervision, support and training to the Supervising Social Workers to ensure that high quality practice is an achievable aim for all Social Workers in line with Key Assets and the group’s Vision and Values
  • Show clear leadership within the social work team and work in close liaison with the Director and Recruitment/Placements Manager
  • Demonstrate a high level of knowledge, skills and expertise in Social Work practice
  • Ensure that Social Work Practice in relation to quality assurance and best practice is maintained in all cases and at all times 

Experience and Skills Required

  • To demonstrate expertise and commitment to a growing team and the service you will provide
  • Bring high energy, enthusiasm and a passion for the role
  • Must have a minimum of 5 years’ experience as a qualified social worker in a children and family setting of which preferably two years working directly with foster carers and children placed with them.
  • Show evidence of leadership and supervisory experience
  • Have a strong ability to build sustainable relationships with all stakeholders
  • Must have a comprehensive working knowledge of all relevant legislation pertaining to children’s services and of all policies and procedures in relation to Safeguarding children
  • You will continue to develop effective partnerships with the Department of Health and Human Services as well as developing networks within the sector and with other local community service providers and provide Social Work guidance and support to the team and Foster Carers

Benefits 

  • Salary Packaging options
  • Superannuation at 9.5%,
  • On going supervision and professional development
  • Motor vehicle, mobile phone and laptop

If you feel as strongly as we do, that all children deserve to have access to quality family placements then this is the challenge for you.

113279.title: Team Leader - Information Call-Centre - Tumut
113279.summary:
We are seeking an experienced help-line or call-centre manager, ideally with experience in the community services or health promotion sectors. 
Based in Tumut, NSW.
113279.description:
IDEAS supports people with disabilities Australia-wide by providing quality independent information through its websites, a telephone support line, training, consulting, print publications and community events.

One of Australia’s most significant social reforms has resulted in major changes in the Disability sector. Ensuring people with disabilities, their families and carers, have access to information, and are connected to exercise their life choices becomes even more important; and IDEAS is well positioned to be the premier, national provider of independent disability information.

The coming year will be one of change, growth and expansion and we are seeking additional staff to join us. If you are committed to social justice and equity, and understand the needs and rights of people with disability, we are keen to hear from you. As we are a small organisation operating in a rapidly changing environment, we value team-work, initiative and adaptability.

This role manages the day to day operations of IDEAS’ call centre, providing first point of contact support (telephone and on-line) for people seeking disability related information. The role also contributes to the development of our information databases which underpin our information provision.

To be successful in the role, you will have:

  • Considerable experience in information/help-line centres/offices, ideally in the community services or health promotion sectors;
  • A customer service focus;
  • The capacity to manage complex issues and the support of people in crisis;
  • A comprehensive understanding of the Disability sector, including relevant regulatory requirements, the NDIS and the UNCRPD;
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills;
  • Leadership and management skills; and
  • An ability to analyse performance and trends;

Ideally, you will also have qualifications in community services, health or business management.

This is a unique opportunity to work with a small, multi-disciplined and professional team making a contribution to the empowerment of people with disability.

The position is full-time, based in Tumut for one year (with the possibility of extension), with some travel required. SCHADS Award provisions apply, with generous salary packaging available.

Victorian Aboriginal Child Care Agency (VACCA) operates within the context that Aboriginal children continue to be significantly over-represented in the protection and care system within Victoria. 113205.title: Client Service Officer
113205.summary: Have you thought about a career in Social Housing? An excellent industry that offers great rewards and career opportunity supporting those in need.
113205.description:
• Parramatta or Lewisham location

Our client has recently merged with a larger housing provider and their combined mission is to provide appropriate, secure and affordable housing to those who are homeless or at risk of homelessness and to work in partnership with their communities and all levels of government to build inclusive neighbourhoods which are socially, environmentally and economically sustainable.

The Client Service Officer reports to the General Manager and works in a team of 5 to provide tenancy and property management services to 110-120 clients households. The role is varied, busy and extremely rewarding.

Ideally you come from a tenancy management background either in real estate or social housing and understand the issues surrounding those affected by housing and homelessness.

You will be responsible for:

  1. Property inspections and ensuring properties are maintained
  2. Managing rent, rent arrears and other debt
  3. Working with support providers to help the tenant sustain their tenancy
  4. Responding to tenant inquiries, complaints and appeals
  5. Accurately recording all tenant information in the tenant management system.

Please respond to the following essential criteria in your cover letter:

  • Your experience in tenancy management with a focus on how you have supported clients who are disadvantaged, vulnerable or with multiple and complex needs.
  • An outline of your technical knowledge in property inspections and maintenance issues
  • Your knowledge and experience with using tenancy management systems
  • Your knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act and experience with representation at the NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal (NCAT)
  • Your ability to meet arrears, vacant, void and other KPI’s

To ensure your success in this role you must have:

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications and/or equivalent work experience
  • Sound understanding of tenancy management and programs
  • Strong organisational and time management skills
  • A commitment to excellence in service delivery and customer satisfaction
  • A belief that safe and affordable housing is a right for everyone
  • Excellent relationship management and communication skills
  • A resilient and positive nature who demonstrates honesty, integrity and empathy.

The position offers an excellent salary, salary packaging benefits and career opportunity. You must have a drivers license and be able to pass a police history and working with children check. Please include these in your application if you have them.

113166.summary: Responsible for managing multidisciplinary and multifaceted services  and the day to day service delivery to support children and young people in Out of Home Care.
113166.description:
• Work with youth at risk for a large and innovative NFP
  • Be part of exciting new projects and travelling opportunities
  • 10 plus years' experience in a leadership

TaylorCare has partnered with one of the largest not-for-profit community service providers in NSW with a rich history of providing services to the community for more than 100 years. 

This is a management role within the Out of Home Care and working in Western Sydney and covering regional NSW too and is responsible the management of Out of Home Care / Permanency Support programs across the organisation so that all programs’ vision, philosophy and day to day practice are consistent and meet the needs of vulnerable children, young people and their families. 

The position has operational and duty of care responsibility for all authorised foster and kinship carers, staff members, and children and young people in the foster care and aftercare program.

To be eligible to apply:

  • Degree in psychology or social work (Master level qualifications preferably) with substantial (10 plus years) leadership experience, professional qualifications and expertise in operations where this relates to working with vulnerable children, young people and their families.
  • Demonstrated ability in establishing strategic partnerships, and achieving common desired outcomes with relevant communities.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead and manage people; develop and maintain motivated, professional and effective work team/s in a diverse work environment.
  • Sound understanding of issues affecting disadvantaged children and young people, their families and communities.
  • Demonstrated excellence in working with Aboriginal people, families and organisations and planning, delivering and evaluating services in a culturally competent manner.
  • Proven ability to prepare funding submissions, obtain funding and develop, deliver, monitor and evaluate services.
  • Sound financial management skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • A current driver’s licence with ability to travel to meet the operational needs of the different sites.
  • Project Management skills.
  • Community development experience and skills.

Your role will involve the following

  • Provide efficient and effective management of the Out of Home Care team.
  • Drive and manage the transition as part of OOHC recommissioning to a Permanency Support service that emphasises restoration as the preferred long term option for children who come into care.
  • Lead the review and implementation of policies and procedures that form the framework of the Permanency Support program.
  • Drive and manage changes in the organisation structure that supports the Permanency Support program.
  • Ensure service delivery partnerships are developed with external service providers and organisations including government and other non-government providers.
  • Work in support of other Uniting functions and teams to foster coordination across the organisation, avoiding duplication, standardizing on efficient processes and delivering continuous improvement.

Salary package on offer is $150,000 - $160,000 per annum and other benefits depending on qualifications and experience.

113146.title: National Community Fundraising Manager
113146.summary: Newly branded charity seeks an experienced Community Fundraising Manager responsible for growing community fundraising revenue and community development through a number of mediums.
113146.description:
Newly branded charity seeks experienced Community Fundraising Manager responsible for growing community fundraising revenue and community development through a number of mediums. 

  • Based in North Ryde, Sydney 
  • Competitive salary
  • Parking on site
  • Flexible working hours
  • Opportunity to manage and lead a team 

About the organisation

Dementia Australia is the new voice of Alzheimer’s Australia - a unified, national peak body for people, of all ages, living with all forms of dementia, their families and carers.

They advocate for the needs of people living with all types of dementia, and for their families and carers, and provide support services, education and information.

Role Summary

Reporting to the General Manager of National Fundraising and supervising a team of 2 direct reports and 5 indirect, the National Community Fundraising Manager will be responsible for driving community development and growing revenue through a number of channels.

This is a great opportunity where you will be responsible for increasing the income through community fundraising, managing 3rd party agencies and community fundraising campaigns.  

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive revenue growth for Dementia through developing community fundraising campaigns
  • Manage relevant 3rd party agencies to ensure that Dementia Australia is maximising the relationships
  • Management of community fundraising campaigns, including briefing, proofing copy and design, managing budgets and reporting
  • Support General Manager in developing analysis and forecasting models
  • Provide support for fundraising events and activities
  • Manage various fundraising platforms (Just Giving, Everyday Hero and GoFundraise)
  • Manage and develop in Memoriam portfolio
  • Liaise with regional staff, volunteers and committees

Skills & Attributes

  • Experienced fundraiser with entrepreneurial approach, positive outgoing personality
  • Creative, imaginative and a willingness to try anything
  • Excellent interpersonal skill and an ability to build relationships
  • Highly developed written and verbal communication skills
  • A self-starter with experience of using online fundraising platforms
  • Proven ability to develop excellent relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously
  • Genuine interest in the charity sector
  • At least a few years’ experience in fundraising with a good understanding direct marketing
  • Proven experience of scheduling, briefing and managing projects
  • Proven track record of raising income from a fundraising portfolio

Culture

This role offers the opportunity to work in a hardworking and positive environment where the team are committed to achieving results for the charity. You will have the satisfaction of knowing that your work has a real impact on families across Australia. 

Benefits

  • Opportunities for professional development
  • New, unified organisation
  • Salary packaging available
  • Flexible environment
