113072.title: Family Practitioners / Therapists - Shepparton
113072.summary: OzChild is expanding the Functional Family Therapy Child Welfare Program which will be delivered from our newly established office in Shepparton, to prevent children entering the care system.
113072.description:
OzChild is expanding the Functional Family Therapy Child Welfare (FFT-CW) Program which will be delivered from our newly established office in Shepparton, to prevent children entering the care system.

  • Multiple Positions
  • Permanent Full Time
  • Shepparton Location
  • Collaborative & Supportive work culture

The opportunity

The FFT-CW model has clear requirements of staff experience and qualifications.

We are seeking tertiary qualified candidates from the following disciplines; Psychologists, counsellors, family therapists with experience working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Families.

To set you for success you and your team will be closely supported by the model developers with structured professional development and training to implement the model with fidelity increasing the likelihood of achieving sustainable outcomes.

Suitably qualified candidates with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background are strongly encouraged to apply for these roles.

You'll be part of a collaborative and supportive work culture, that provides you with opportunity to thrive in your career and be part of positive change within the sector.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Providing home-based interventions adhering to Functional Family Therapy - Child Welfare (FFT - CW) model.
  • Creating written phase & session plans that are tailored to the family.
  • Using methods compatible with principles and practices of specified model, provide direct engagement, motivation and generalisation.
  • Addressing the needs of clients through model adherent referrals to community partners.
  • Working with the team to identify and overcome barriers to engagement/motivation.

Specific requirements include

  • Masters/ Bachelor degree in Psychology, social work, counselling or equivalent.
  • Experience in family therapy, counselling, clinical or therapeutic work with children, youth and families.
  • Demonstrated understanding of working with vulnerable and at risk families.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children, families and communities.

The hours of work for this role are between the hours of 8 am and 8pm. In order to perform the duties of the role effectively it will be necessary to be flexible in order to meet your clients' needs. OzChild has a flexible approach to hours of work.

If you want to be part of a shift in sector practice and thinking, we offer all you need to build a brighter future. If you are interested in this position, don't delay.

We seeking the successful applicants to commence late August 2018.

To find out more about OzChild and the services we provide, please visit www.ozchild.org.au.

A full position description is available below.

  • Plan, develop and drive growth of Landcare Australia’s corporate partnerships/business development functions.
  • Build pipeline of new business opportunities and progress through the sales pipeline.
  • Establish and maintain effective relationships with Landcare Australia’s internal business units and stakeholders to ensure proposals are deliverable, profitable and expectations are clear.
  • Develop budgets and forecasts, provide regular reporting on sales forecasts.
  • Effectively manage corporate partner accounts to ensure renewal and growth.
  • Work collaboratively with other Partnerships Managers to transition new corporate partners across to account management.  

Reporting to the Head of Corporate Partnerships, you will be responsible for developing new business partnerships, driving profitable revenue for Landcare Australia to ensure delivery of Landcare’s mission.

Ideally you will be proactive and a passionate partnerships/business development professional with proven success of driving growth. You will have experience working in a small team environment and are able to juggle multiple deadlines and priorities.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a small, friendly team for a highly regarded national organisation and use your partnerships experience for a very worthy cause.

Skills and Attributes

To be considered you MUST HAVE:

  • Tertiary qualifications in business or other relevant qualifications
  • Significant experience in prospecting and building new business
  • Proven track record in reaching revenue and performance targets
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills including proven ability to build mutually beneficial relationships
  • A passion for and ideally experience of working in the environment, agriculture or not-for-profit sectors.
  • Excellent people skills and an ability to deal with government and corporate representatives
  • Experience and competency with CRM databases and proficiency in MS Office
  • Full driver’s license with a good driving record

You will be able to work autonomously, strategically multi-task and prioritise while working to deadlines, have exceptional interpersonal and communications skills, be goal orientated, energetic and collaborative.

112510.title: Manager - Catalyst Programs
112510.summary: Catalyst is a six week, non-residential ‘day' rehabilitation program for people who have experienced problematic alcohol and other drug use.
112510.description:
• Leading community services organisation
  • Generous salary packaging benefits
  • Full Time (76 hours per fortnight), Maximum Term (until June 2019) - may be extended subject to ongoing DHHS funding)

About Uniting

At Uniting we are passionate about working together to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.

We are proud to have been part of local communities for over 100 years delivering services across Victoria and Tasmania. With a team of 7,000 skilled and committed individuals we provide over 770 programs and services to people of all ages to learn, thrive and enjoy a healthy, happy life. We’re there for children, families, people with disability, older people and those experiencing homelessness, mental illness or drug and alcohol addiction.

Uniting is looking for great people who, like us, celebrate diversity and welcome everyone regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity.

Learn more vt.uniting.org

About the opportunity

Catalyst is a six week, non-residential ‘day' rehabilitation program for people who have experienced problematic alcohol and other drug use. It is for clients who have completed a withdrawal and need a period of intensive therapeutic support to prevent relapse and maintain their changed behaviour.  The core components utilise a mixture of cognitive behavioural group therapy and one to one motivational enhancement to increase their insight and broaden the participants' repertoire of coping skills. The program also takes an holistic approach to treatment and change and so offers client the opportunity to engage in a range of other sessions including art therapy, yoga, drumming, gym, pharmacotherapy education, liver health education, financial counselling, nutrition, deep relaxation, mindfulness,  job network sessions and family relationships group sessions.

You will be responsible for program management and evaluation, development of new program opportunities, implementation and operational management of all existing programs and the Catalyst team. Reporting to Senior Manager - Programs you will achieve success through high quality, evidence based and collaborative approach to the services delivered, promoted and reviewed in a timely and cost effective manner.

About you

We are looking for candidates with tertiary qualifications in a health and/or welfare related discipline, qualifications in management, AOD core competencies, competencies in Mental health /dual diagnosis (or willingness to complete within the first 12 months of employment). Demonstrated experience in a management or leadership position in a health service setting, preferably in the AOD or Mental Health Sector will be highly regarded.

A full position description is available below.
112510.application:

When applying please indicate the position you are applying for, include a cover letter outlining your suitability by addressing the key selection criteria and attach a current resume of no more than 3 pages.

Get in touch

E: jobs@regen.org.au, using the subject line: Manager - Catalyst Programs enquiry via EthicalJobs.

T: 03 9384 8843 – Trevor King 

Uniting is a child safe organisation and is committed in everyday practice to ensure the safety and wellbeing of all children, at all times. As a ‘child safe’ organisation, employment with Uniting is subject to a satisfactory national (and international where relevant) police check and Working with Children Check (in Victoria) and/or Working with Vulnerable People Check (in Tasmania) prior to commencement of any paid or unpaid work and/or participation in any service or undertaking.

112500.title: Coordinator - People and Culture
112500.summary: The Coordinator, People and Culture holds a key position which is responsible for a broad range of people and culture policies, programs and practices.
112500.description:
Participate Australia has been supporting people with disabilities since 1983, previously as Family Resource and Network Support Incorporated (FRANS). In March 2017 our organisation undertook a transfer to a company limited by guarantee under the new name, Participate Australia.

We believe that 'participation' is fundamental to a contemporary discourse about disability. It appears 26 times in one way or another in the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, which seeks to achieve full participation in society of people living with disability. We are committed to playing our part in supporting people with disabilities to achieve this goal.

Participate Australia makes a difference in the lives of people with disabilities by respecting their dignity, autonomy, freedom of choice and independence, and by supporting the achievement of their aspirations.

We strive for a community that respects human dignity and freedom and the personal identities of all people, is non-discriminatory and affirms equality while valuing difference, and sustains full and effective participation and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunity and accessibility.

The Role

The Coordinator, People and Culture holds a key position which is responsible, using technical and professional expertise, for a broad range of people and culture policies, programs and practices, with a major focus on attraction and retention, on-boarding, as well as learning and development.

Reporting to the corporate services manager, the successful candidate will find a supportive environment across the organisation and on all levels. We are looking for candidates with a strong understanding and knowledge of relevant legislation relating to employment, work, health and safety and industrial relations.

The successful applicant will be an enthusiastic and dedicated professional who can demonstrate a high level of organisational and time management skills, who understands and embraces the significant sector reforms that are underway and who supports and is committed to the objectives of the United Nation Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disability.  

Essential

  • Professional qualifications in an appropriate HR related discipline or have at least twelve months experience in a generalist HR position;
  • Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, listening, presentation and negotiation) and an ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of people;
  • An ability to deliver results to agreed timetables;
  • Flexible attitude to working hours;
  • Familiarity with a range of computer applications;
  • Strong and versatile problem solving abilities;
  • Proven ability to effectively manage relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders;
  • Hold a strong commitment to enhancing the lives of people with disabilities and their families;
  • Willingness to undertake continuing professional development, as appropriate, and
  • Respect and value the inherent worth of Participate Australia’s participants and their families, as well as employees and volunteers, based upon the principles of trust, fairness, equality and ethics.
  • Current NSW driver’s license;

Desirable

  • Understanding of the issues facing the disability sector.

A generous salary packaging option can be offer as a part of the total remuneration.

To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

A full position description is available below.
112500.application:
If you wish to apply please send your resume and a cover letter addressing the selection criteria to lbaldacchino@participateaustralia.com.au, using the subject line: Coordinator - People and Culture application via EthicalJobs.

If you wish to discuss the role further please contact Lorraine Baldacchino on 0416 247 729.

Please Note: Applications will be reviewed on receipt and shortlisted applicants will be interviewed until a successful applicant has been appointed. Please submit your application as soon as possible.

112447.organisation_name: The Salvation Army – South Australia/Northern Territory
112447.title: Children & Families Ministry Assistant
112447.summary: In this newly created Ministry Assistant role you will coordinate and develop programs and activities to engage children (0-12 years) and their families in faith formation and discipleship.
112447.description:
We have a part-time (20 hour per week) position available at CitySalvos until June 2019.

The Salvation Army is a Christian movement dedicated to sharing the love of Jesus by caring for people, creating faith pathways, building healthy communities and working for justice.

City Salvos Adelaide is a vibrant and progressive community based in the city of Adelaide. As a Christian church, our community of faith is made-up of people who are young, old and in-between, from a range of backgrounds and lifestyles all united by a love of God and passion for this City. Because we love this city like Jesus does, City Salvos offers a range of activities and services aimed at making a practical and meaningful difference to the lives of others. 

In this newly created Ministry Assistant role you will coordinate and develop programs and activities to engage children (0-12 years) and their families in faith formation and discipleship. In this role you will also help to extend our outreach to the local community and train new leaders with a view to building a committed, capable and sustained team of volunteers.   

Any program with kids involved is a lot of FUN! What we need is someone to take the reins and grow this particular ministry from the ground up.

To be successful in this role you will:

  • Have the ability to proactively lead ministries in a manner that engages children and their families;
  • Be experienced in developing programs, workshops and working with non-churched youth from a variety of backgrounds;
  • Hold a diploma in theology or be close to completing such a qualification with relevant transferable skills;
  • Be a committed to upholding the mission and values of The Salvation Army and demonstrates these personally whilst encouraging others to embrace the same; &
  • Sound communication (both oral and written) and computer skills that enable you to interact and network positively with a variety of people.

General enquiries including a copy of the position description can be obtained from susan.wallace@aus.salvationarmy.org.

The Salvation Army is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that Supports an inclusive approach and is committed to the safety, inclusion, participation and empowerment of all people within the workplace.  We celebrate diversity and welcome staff regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation, gender identity and lifestyle choices, Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Candidates must be willing to work within the vision and mission values of The Salvation Army and be able to provide a DCSI working with vulnerable persons and police clearance.

A full position description is available below.

About the Organisation

Life Without Barriers is a leading social purpose, not for profit organisation of 6,100 employees working in more than 440 communities across Australia. We support children, young people and families, people with disability, older people and people with mental illness. We work with people who are homeless and refugees and asylum seekers.

As our Driving Instructor you will be responsible for delivering practical and theory Manual Driver Licence education to target our clients, while ensuring that appropriate records are maintained. 112415.title: Financial Counsellors x2
112415.summary: This is a dynamic and challenging opportunity for an experienced professional to join a committed organisation that is well respected in the sector.
112415.description:
Wesley Community & Family Care

  • 1 x full-time & 1 x part-time position available
  • based in Sydney CBD & Ashfield
  • salary + super + salary packaging benefits

About us

Wesley Mission is a high profile, multi-faceted Christian organisation making a real difference in the community. We work with the most disadvantaged in our community by providing over 200 services ranging from aged care, homeless services, child and family care, counselling, employment, training and education, and health services.

Our Vision is “Do all the good you can, by all the means you can, in all the ways you can, in all the places you can, at all the times you can, to all the people you can, as long as ever you can.”

About the program

Wesley Financial Counselling is a free, face-to-face, confidential counselling service. We offer counselling and support to people dealing with the emotional trauma and distress caused by financial crisis. It is a comprehensive, specialist counselling service that provides assistance toward gaining financial independence but does not lend money. We offer one-on-one financial counselling, ongoing casework services and consumer education.

Wesley Financial Counselling provides help to people who:

  • have financial concerns or wish to avoid such worries in the future
  • cannot meet their financial commitments
  • are spending more than they earn
  • require help to sort out family finances
  • need advice on money management and budgeting
  • have a financial problem associated with an addiction
  • Financial Counsellors are able to provide:
  • information, analysis of options, negotiation, mediation and referrals
  • advocacy on behalf of clients with creditors
  • short-term crisis management and long-term prevention strategies
  • education and advice on options, financial management skills such as budgeting and personal cash flow management

About the role

Wesley Community & Family Care is currently seeking 2 x financial counsellors to work on a full-time & part-time basis.

The full-time position is based in in the city on Monday & Tuesday and in Ashfield Wednesday – Friday. The part-time position (4 days per week) located in Sydney CBD.

This is a dynamic and challenging opportunity for an experienced professional to join a committed organisation that is well respected in the sector.

Essential criteria

  • relevant tertiary qualification and/or equivalent in counselling or psychology
  • sound background and training in financial counselling
  • experience and/or competency in deliverying community education programs
  • crisis telephone assessment and counselling skills
  • accredited member of the Financial Counsellors Association of NSW (or working towards)
  • demonstrate highly developed communication skills in written and oral situations, with supportive & positive attitude toward all persons for whom there is responsibility, accountability or care
  • computer literacy
  • excellent time management, multi-tasking and follow-up skills
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • willingness to affirm Wesley Mission’s vision, mission and values
  • current NSW driver’s license
  • current working with children’s check

Desirable criteria

  • an interest in and/or knowledge of problem gambling issues
  • sounds background and training in general counselling
  • experience in trauma counselling

Benefits of working at Wesley Mission

  • employee Support Program
  • access to discounted health and travel insurance
  • career growth and training opportunities in a valuable sector
  • attractive tax saving salary packaging
112415.application:
Apply now

Please submit a copy of your CV/resume and a cover letter addressing all the selection criteria. For further information, or to submit an application, please contact:

Contact name: Therese Slan
Email: therese.slan@wesleymission.org.au, using the subject line: Financial Counsellor application via EthicalJobs

Closing date Friday 6 July 2018 by 5pm

Wesley Mission is a Christian organisation requiring all staff to affirm its values. We are committed to providing an environment in which children can feel safe and valued.

The suitable applicant will be subject to the relevant pre-employment checks for appointment to positions within Wesley Mission. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

We are a well regarded not-for-profit, values based organisation, offering residential, community and in-home aged care for over 30 years, to older people living in and around the municipality of Manningham.

We are looking for a Maintenance Manager who will drive the growth and productivity of our home maintenance service including our growing private client base, as well as managing the maintenance of our aged care facilities located in Doncaster.

About You

112339.title: NDIS Appeals Support Officer / Advocate - Geelong
112339.summary: The NDIS Appeals Support Officer / Advocate will play a key role in providing support and assistance to applicants whilst they navigate the process of seeking an AAT review of NDIS decisions.
112339.description:

  • Fixed term until 30th June 2019
  • Based in Geelong

RIAC is a not for profit organisation operating throughout central and north western Victoria, Geelong and southern NSW providing information, advocacy and NDIS appeals support to individuals, families, carers and communities.

The NDIS Appeals Support Officer/Advocate will play a key role in providing support and assistance to applicants whilst they navigate the process of seeking an AAT review of NDIS decisions. There will be a strong focus on fostering ‘self-advocacy’ where possible. Where self-advocacy is not appropriate, the NDIS Appeals officer will, in partnership with the applicant, develop and implement a plan which will provide effective support. 112318.title: Senior NDIS ECEI Coordinator - Outer Gippsland Region
112318.summary: The Senior ECEI Coordinator you will provide leadership, mentorship and supervision. You will have demonstrated expertise and experience working with families who have complex needs.
112318.description:
• Early Childhood Educators/Allied Health Professionals
  • Senior ECEI Coordinator roles available in Inner and Outer Eastern Melbourne, Southern Melbourne and Outer Gippsland 

Link Health and Community (Link HC) is a multi-sited community health service providing a comprehensive range of health, early childhood and community services.

Link HC is the NDIS ECEI Community Partner for Inner and Outer Eastern Melbourne, Southern Melbourne and Inner and Outer Gippsland areas.

The ECEI approach supports children aged 0-6 years who have a developmental delay or disability and their family/carers. The ECEI approach supports families to help children develop the skills they need to take part in daily activities and achieve the best possible outcomes throughout their life.  

In addition to the ECEI Coordinator duties, as a Senior ECEI Coordinator you will provide leadership, mentorship and supervision. You will have demonstrated expertise and experience working with families who have complex needs.

  • Early Childhood Education
  • Occupational Therapy
  • Speech Pathology
  • Physiotherapy

You will have experience delivering services/support to children with developmental delay or disability. A current Police Check, Working with Children Check, Victorian drivers licence and registered motor vehicle, clinical or professional registration and Level II First Aid (inclusive of CPR) certification are essential.

Link HC is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We encourage all suitable applicants to apply. Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia.

111701.title: Support Worker - Gosford & Central Coast
111701.summary: Utilise your existing skills in providing complex support and personal care to assist people to maintain their independence.
111701.description:
• Support people to live independently in the community
  • Innovative support project
  • Work a variety of morning, day and night shifts

Ability Options is one of the longest running not for profit organisations in NSW. When you join Ability Options you have the opportunity to experience a fast paced, values driven organisation where we put people at the centre of all that we do. Your commitment to our values of inclusion, respect, trust, integrity, and courage, and your determination to see people fulfill their potential will ensure that we can continue our mission of assisting all people to live their best life possible.

The Role

As a Support Worker within our team, you will be supporting people to increase their independence, participation and engagement in the community and to assist with personal care and domestic assistance. You will encourage people to build on their strengths, to assist them to achieve their goals and to be able to live as independently as possible.

We are currently looking for a group of support workers to join our team that are reliable, flexible and have availability to work a roster from Monday to Sunday. Work flexibly, with a mix of morning, afternoon, and sleepover shifts.

Essential Criteria:

  • Demonstrated experience in working with people with complex, high support needs
  • Willingness to assist with personal care

111526.title: Fundraising Officer - Community & Campaigns
111526.summary: Our Community & Campaigns team is growing. Combine your experience in customer service & passion for being part of something bigger to find the perfect career.
111526.description:
• North Sydney Location
  • 12 Month Contract - With Career Prospects
  • Happy, Fun & Successful Team

Every breast cancer experience is different. That's why the McGrath Foundation aims to make life that little bit easier for individuals and families experiencing breast cancer. We raise money to place specialist McGrath Breast Care Nurses, wherever they're needed.

Since 2005, more than 60,000 families have been supported by 119 McGrath Breast Care Nurses in communities across Australia.

Our Community & Campaigns team is growing with a fantastic opportunity for a 12 month contract. 

Make a difference by: 

  • Provide expert front line customer service for donors and supporters
  • Proactively engage with the community and Foundation supporters to drive growth across our key campaigns including national campaigns Pull On Your Socks & Pink Up Your Town
  • Utilise your high energy to build meaningful relationships and identify fundraising opportunities within the community
  • Utilise your excel skills to provide reporting on fundraising activity and call volumes to the Campaign Manager

You need to be:

  • Happy, fun & confident, making sure our supporters feel special every time you interact with them.
  • A people person, you’ll be on the phone answering queries most of the day, so helping people out has to be what you love to do.
  • A clear communicator with a high attention to detail, we like our supporters to have their queries answered the first time.
  • Creative problem solver, you’ll always consider the road less travelled and help our supporters in any way you can.

We give you:

  • The best career karma working for a reputable & impactful charity organisation
  • Employee Benefits including tax benefits, sports teams, lunch & learns & flu shots
  • Combine your experience in customer service & passion for being part of something bigger to find the perfect career

111508.title: Information Support and Service Advisor - Dubbo
111508.summary: Provide an information and referral service to families of primary age children for the Carers NSW Better Start for Children with Disability Initiative.
111508.description:
• 30 hours per week, contract to 28 June 2019
  • Work within a small but passionate professional team
  • Dubbo location

Carers NSW is the peak body for carers in NSW. We are a not-for-profit organisation connecting and empowering carers across NSW and improving their quality of life through activities, programs, training and policy advice. We advocate for carers of all ages and circumstances.

This position is responsible for providing an information and referral service to families of primary age children for Carers NSW Better Start for Children with Disability Initiative. This includes providing information and support to access the NDIS, understanding service pathways to support regardless of NDIS eligibility and the Early Childhood Early Intervention approach. There will be an emphasis on working with Aboriginal families and communities. This role is also responsible for arranging and facilitating Moving Forward Workshops across regional NSW.

To be successful in this role, administration will be one of your greatest strengths, and you will have the ability to demonstrate empathy and an awareness of the sensitivities of dealing with young families with a recent diagnosis. You will have impeccable attention to detail and a personable phone manner.

The successful applicant will also possess:

  • An understanding of and ability to work with the Aboriginal community and key stakeholders.
  • Tertiary qualification in Social Work or other relevant discipline or relevant work experience.
  • Ability to liaise effectively with a diverse range of people including carers, health professionals, and service providers.
  • Experience in the preparation, facilitation and delivery of workshops.
  • Knowledge of relevant information related to referral pathways such as the NDIS, Disability services and other programs relevant to carers.
  • Understanding of family advocacy and the complaints process available to families if required.
  • Understanding of intake, assessment and relevant processes provided as part of an information service.
  • Strong understanding of Mandatory Reporting and Privacy requirements.
  • Strong administration and organisation skills.

The Annual Salary Package is between $62 – $66K inclusive of superannuation. You will also have access to generous salary sacrificing benefits. The Position Description is available to assist with your application.

Aboriginal people from the local region are strongly encouraged to apply.

Carers NSW recognises the value of diversity in its workplace and acknowledges the contributions that people of diverse backgrounds bring to the organisation.

A criminal record check and working with children check will be required as a condition of employment.

111505.organisation_name: The Human Equation on behalf of client
111505.title: Chief Executive Officer - Unisson Disability
111505.summary: Opportunity to head up an established, well-respected disability service organisation.
111505.description:
Established in 1924, Unisson Disability (formerly The Lorna Hodgkinson Sunshine Home) is one of the most well-respected disability organisations in NSW. The organisation is well-known for its quality support to people with disability and their families.  Its suite of service offerings includes shared and supported living, drop-in support, community leisure and education-based activities, short-term accommodation and supported employment.

The Board is composed of dedicated and skilled individuals who are committed to the organisation’s purpose of ‘working with clients and families to create possibilities for a great life’.

Unisson is seeking an accomplished and experienced leader who will have the overall responsibility of leading the organisation, including directing the strategy, developing the necessary processes and infrastructure that will drive quality service performance, improving overall brand presence and maintaining financial viability.

The candidate with exceptional skills will embody the same culture and values that has made Unisson the well-respected organisation it is today. The new CEO will need to be able to build on the organisation’s capabilities and achievements and take Unisson ahead in the new world of the NDIS funding regime, over the next 5 to 10 years.

For more information about this role, please see the attached document.

111487.title: Service Manager Supported Independent Living
111487.summary: The Service Manager will oversee multiple services that are based in Albert Park, Armadale and Williamstown, and in the short-term manage Day to Day Living and Family and Carers services.
111487.description:
• Work full time, 38 hours per week
  • Albert Park, Armadale and Williamstown Locations

Want to make a difference in the community through supporting mental health recovery?

Mind Australia Limited (Mind) is well recognised for service excellence and industry leading service offerings across the mental health sector. Mind is changing its operational structure from regional divisions into three specialised service streams: Sub-acute residential partnership services, Supported independent living and Mind centres. The service stream approach supports our goal to be customer focused in everything we do, ultimately providing the customer with a better Mind experience.

As a result, an opportunity has arisen to join our Supported Independent Living team as a Service Manager. The Service Manager will oversee multiple services that are based in Albert Park, Armadale and Williamstown, and in the short-term manage Day to Day Living and Family and Carers services. Reporting to the General Manager Supported Independent Living you will be responsible and accountable for:

  • leading and managing services to customers, carers and families as defined in the Model of Recovery Oriented Practice and related guidelines to ensure that individually tailored services for customers and their family and carers are provided to the highest standard
  • leading and managing the service team in line with organisation quality processes and policies, agreed priorities and strategies to ensure quality customer service and required targets are met
  • leading a high performance team through engaging staff, setting clear direction and performance expectations
  • ensuring performance targets are monitored and met as designated
  • ensure performance targets as designated by the organisation are monitored and met

Success in this role will require you to demonstrate:

  • experience in mental health service delivery
  • an understanding of service development and design
  • demonstrated ability to plan and prioritise to meet Mind’s strategic and operational plan
  • exceptional customer service skills
  • a demonstrated history of staff leadership and management
  • experience in financial management, budget control and reporting.
  • advanced computer skills and information technology literacy

If you want to take the next step in your career, then we’d love to hear from you.

111447.title: Community Mental Health Practitioner - Volunteer Coordinator
111447.summary: Do you have what it takes to be a Volunteer Coordinator with one of Australia's leading mental health providers? Join our team at the PALS service located in South Morang.
111447.description:
• Work part time, 30.4 hours per week on a fixed term contact until 30 June 2019
  • South Morang Location

Help people to gain better mental health, and improve the quality of their lives.

Make a difference in the community through supporting mental health recovery. Mind offers you a supportive team environment, flexible work arrangements and career development opportunities.

Do you have what it takes to be a Volunteer Coordinator with one of Australia's leading mental health providers? Join our team at the PALS service located in South Morang. The PALS service is a state funded program that offers support to volunteers and consumers throughout Metropolitan Melbourne. The program assists in reconnecting individuals to the local community and supporting them to engage in social and recreational activities. Volunteers are matched one-to-one with a person living with a serious mental illness, meeting once a fortnight for around two hours.

In this role you will:

  • work part time, 30.4 hours per week on a fixed term contact until 30 June 2019
  • work within a recovery oriented framework to support clients and Volunteers
  • develop rapport and trusting relationships with clients and volunteers
  • recruit volunteers to provide support to clients
  • provide information, training and supervision to volunteers to provide social and recreational support to clients in the community
  • receive and manage client referrals from a broad range of referral sources

You will have:

  • tertiary qualifications (minimum Certificate IV) in Mental Health, Psychology, Social Work, Occupational Therapy, or other health-related field as designated by Mind
  • previous experience supporting volunteers and people with mental health issues
  • experience or demonstrated capacity to provide supervision, support and training to volunteers
  • sound client engagement and coordination skills

111439.title: Job Support Consultant - The Entrance
111439.summary: Make a difference by supporting people to maintain long term employment. An opportunity exists for a strongly influential and encouraging Job Support Consultant to join our high performing team.
111439.description:

  • High performing provider
  • Innovative service delivery model with demonstrated success

Who are we?

Olympus Solutions is a part of the Ability Options community and is a leading provider of Disability Employment Services in Sydney.

We are growing and our excellent performance has resulted in receiving an invitation to provide Disability Employment Services across Greater Sydney.

This has opened up opportunities for passionate, results driven individuals who value making a difference in the lives of people in the community through employment.

The Role

An opportunity exists for a strongly influential and encouraging Job Support Consultant to join our high performing team. You will have a highly empowering style and the ability to influence clients and employers alike. You will be proactive and passionate about assisting people to maintain their employment, and overcoming any barrier that may stand in the way. Building relationships with others will come naturally to you as will you as will your ability to think 'outside of the box' and approach any situation with a ‘can-do’ attitude.

You will be responsible for:

  • Managing a diverse caseload and key relationships with clients
  • Assisting job seekers to maintain employment and work towards independence
  • Providing on-the-job support and training – please be prepared to get your hands dirty!
  • Building rapport with key employers to assist clients in maintaining employment
  • Developing and recognising further business opportunities
  • Gathering documentary evidence to meet contractual guidelines for employment outcomes
  • Using compliance tools to strategically meet your outcome targets

Essential Criteria:

  • Current driver licence
  • Own vehicle with Comprehensive Car Insurance
  • Working with Children Check

Why Work for Us?

Our innovative service delivery model is driven by our commitment to ensure all people have the right support to find a job they love that makes a meaningful contribution to their community.

Ability Options is committed to a workplace culture that recognises diversity, equity and human rights, and provides a safe space for everyone. We respect and value the contribution of people from all cultures, backgrounds and lifestyles.

Ability Options is a White Ribbon accredited workplace.

110892.organisation_name: Working Against Violence Support Service Inc.
110892.title: Children's Specialist Counsellor
110892.summary: WAVSS is seeking an experienced full time Domestic and Family Children’s Counsellor to work as part of the supportive team at our Logan office.
110892.description:
Are you PASSIONATE about Hope, Empowerment, Respect and want to help make a difference? If the answer is YES then WAVSS’s wants to meet you!! WAVSS’s is seeking a highly experienced Domestic and Family Violence Counsellor to join our organisation who is ideally:

  • passionate about women’s and the community
  • dedicated to providing quality services for women
  • being part of a proactive, supportive and authentic team

The Role

The Children Specialist Counsellor’s role is to provide counselling to children (ages 5 years and older). Address the impacts of trauma on children and young people using an integrated theoretical counselling approach, the development of safe therapeutic relationships and, in collaboration with the rest of the team, to nurture healthy relationships within the family unit.

You will collaborate in the development and facilitation of therapeutic groups for children, young people, families and parents. You will work collaboratively with team members and other agencies to develop appropriate and innovative responses to violence with the Logan and/or Redlands Community.

This position is 5 days per week.

About You

You will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, enabling you to communicate effectively with a broad range of people and with the team. You will have an extensive understanding of and experience in the domestic and family violence women’s sector. The position offers salary packaging and opportunities to benefit from ongoing professional development provides an opportunity to work within a caring environment with a highly motivated, fun and committed team of professionals

Selection Criteria 

  1. Extensive experience and skills in working effectively with and conducting counselling and group work for children and young people who have or are currently experiencing Domestic and Family Violence, trauma, and the impact of trauma.
  2. Demonstrated ability/proficiency in early childhood development and attachment theory.
  3. A working understanding of current child protection legislation (Child Protection Act 1999).
  4. Understanding of and alignment with a feminist framework and its practical application in a progressive workplace, incorporating demonstrated knowledge of the social, political and gendered nature of Domestic and Family Violence.
  5. Capacity to effectively and appropriately engage with children’s families (mothers, fathers, siblings and significant others in children’s lives).
  6. Please explain why you would like to work with us and what you will bring to the team.
110892.application:
Applications must address the selection criteria along with a resume, which can be emailed to admin@wavss.org using the subject line: Children’s Specialist Counsellor application via EthicalJobs, by close COB Monday 9th July 2018.

112289.title: Implementation Project Officer
112289.summary: Work within the Mission and Mission in Action to be a key support for the implementation and delivery of new residential care developments at our Caulfield site.

About HammondCare

HammondCare is an independent Christian charity that exists to improve quality of life for people in need.

We specialise in aged and dementia care, palliative care, rehabilitation, cancer rehabilitation and mental health services for older people, and other related health and aged care services. HammondCare seeks to embed evidence based best practice in its services and we provide these services through home care, sub-acute hospitals and residential aged care.  

Bringing these health, hospital and aged care services together, HammondCare has been able to develop innovative, flexible care models designed to serve people with complex health or aged care needs, regardless of their circumstances.  

HammondCare works to provide its staff with support, career development opportunities, education, responsibility and recognition, work/life balance, and satisfying roles.

More about the role

The role of the Implementation Project Officer works within the Mission and Mission in Action to be a key support for the implementation and delivery of new residential care developments at our Caulfield site. This role will also support other residential care implementation projects and business improvement projects as they arise.

The essence of this role:

About you

  • Commitment to engage and align with HammondCare’s Christian Mission, Motivation and Mission in Action.
  • A thorough understanding of HammondCare’s Residential Care model of care and the ability to apply it to the workplace.
  • A tertiary degree.
  • Strong administrative and computer skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Empathy and patience.
  • Experience in project support is desirable.

HammondCare offers its staff competitive salaries, excellent training & development opportunities, a supportive environment and a fabulous benefits program. For more info check out our website: www.hammond.com.au/careers.

112199.title: Youth Counsellor - headspace - Wodonga
112199.summary: The Youth Counsellor will fulfil a vital role by working directly with young people to assist them in meeting their needs.
112199.description:
• Part time (up to 12 months fixed term)
  • 30 hours per week
  • Based in Wodonga, Vic

headspace Albury Wodonga commenced operations in January 2015, based at Gateway Health in Wodonga.

headspace Albury Wodonga model brings together key organisations experienced in the delivery of primary care, mental health, alcohol and drug services, health and wellbeing and vocational education for young people.

The headspace Albury Wodonga consortium comprises membership from Albury Wodonga Health, Albury Wodonga Aboriginal Health Services, The Personal Group, Sureway, Junction Support Services, Mind Australia, YES unlimited and Gateway Health as the lead agent. This strategic alliance aims to establish a community of collaborative youth services improving access for young people aged 12-25 years in the early intervention of mental health, work school and study, general health and wellbeing or and alcohol and other drug issues. 

The headspace team consists of a range of staff that are either: employed through headspace funding; existing employees of Gateway Health; staff from partner agencies as listed above; or private providers.

The Youth Counsellor will fulfil a vital role by working directly with young people to assist them in meeting their needs. This may include: individual counselling and support, group work, family-based work, referral and liaison. Some community development activities may also be undertaken in this role. In addition to providing set goals/plans with young people to include short-term brief interventions for complex health issues.

This role is integral to us achieving our vision for headspace Albury Wodonga: an integrated, comprehensive and accessible service which improves the health and mental health of young people in the Albury-Wodonga region, and contributes to the health and wellbeing of their families, their friends and our entire community.

112115.title: Support Workers - Wonthaggi
112115.summary: We are an expanding and innovative not-for-profit with a growth agenda that offers its employees the opportunity to have a career that changes lives.
112115.description:
• Full time, part-time and casual roles available
  • Gippsland area (Wonthaggi)
  • SCHADS Level 2
  • Generous Salary Packaging Benefits

About Us

We are an expanding and innovative not-for-profit with a growth agenda that offers its employees:

  • The opportunity to have a career that changes lives
  • The flexibility in working hours to suit work life balance
  • A supportive and dynamic team environment; and
  • A competitive total package including salary packaging

Ermha exists to ensure that people living with a mental disability and their carers can thrive in and become part of the community.

We choose to work with people who have fallen through the gaps in the system and where there is no obvious support provided. We are often considered the provider of last resort. We also work with people considered at risk to support them to live safely and meaningfully in the community.

We design services and provide individually tailored support, focused on recovery, independence and social inclusion in all our work. In addition, we develop treatment and behaviour support plans and set goals with consumers that help them to identify and change their behaviours of concern and create social inclusion. This focus on behaviour change means that our staff must be capable, qualified, skilled and experienced, and understand how to both support our clients and manage client and community risk.

It’s more than just a job. Our people are passionate, committed and dedicated to making a difference! Together we want to give people the voice, and choice, to thrive!

The Position:

We’re looking for full-time, part-time, and casual Support Workers for our Gippsland team. The pay range we’re offering is Level 2 of the Social Community Services Award

As a support worker for ermha you’ll assist and support individuals (consumers) to develop skills and abilities to manage day to day tasks. Your goal is to enable rather than do, to promote independence, development and confidence of the individuals. Your success will enable individuals to have the voice and choice to thrive in their local communities.

We offer a career development through extensive training and development programs. We also offer a supportive work environment with regular supervision, employees welfare programs and team and organisational events.

Responsibilities:

As a support worker, you’ll meet the individual needs according to an established behavioural support plans which will requires your own learning and input. Along your journey to change the lives of individuals, you’ll be responsible to be a:

  • Change maker - by developing professional relationships with individuals and their families which support them to make positive change. In some instances, these individuals may exhibit challenging behaviors.
  • Advocate - for the individuals to key internal and external stakeholders to ensure the best outcomes
  • Team player -by ensuring you provide an accurate and timely information and support colleagues, stakeholders to ensure a consistent experience for the individuals.

Experience:

Demonstrated experience assisting or supporting people with mental disabilities either within a work or personal context. Experience facilitating individual and/or group activities is desirable.

Requirements:

Not everyone can work with people living with a mental disability. To be seriously considered for the role, please have the following:

To be seriously considered for the role, please have the following:

    • Education: At least a Certificate IV in Individual Support or Disability Work or equivalent qualification or actively studying to achieve.
    • Skills: This position requires effective interpersonal skills and communication skills including the ability to contribute positively within a team and effectively use email and text messages to receive information and communicate with ermha.
    • Characteristics: This is an autonomous position that requires flexibility, patience, initiative and emotional resilience. It’s also a position that requires you to be self-confident, able to advocate for others and communicate with people with a disability and their families, work colleagues and management and members of the community.
    • Conditions of Service: It is a requirement of this position to acquire and maintain a positive working with children’s check, a satisfactory police check, and a Current Driver’s License.

    The Location: 

    Gippsland - (Wonthaggi area).

    A full Position Description is attached below.

112090.title: Team Leader - Residential Care - Bendigo
112090.summary: The Team Leader - Residential Care will work with the Program Manager, Residential Care, to create a therapeutic home environment for young people to recover, grow and aspire.
112090.description:
You are invited to join an enthusiastic and dedicated team providing support and care to young people in a residential setting. As an experienced professional with a social work or equivalent background, you will be working with House Coordinators and other residential youth workers to provide a home environment, foster educational, employment and social engagement, and provide compassionate and trauma-informed practice. You will work with the Program Manager, Residential Care, to create a therapeutic home environment for young people to recover, grow and aspire.

This is a great opportunity for those who are passionate about working with vulnerable children, youth and families.

  • Immediate start in the Bendigo.
  • Working as part of an enthusiastic team supporting young people.
  • Salary Packaging is offered with this position.

About us:

Anglicare Victoria offers a comprehensive network of services to young people, children and their families / caregivers living across Victoria. We seek to provide high quality services that will bring about significant improvements in the life experience of the young people,  children and families / caregivers with whom we work. 

The position:

The successful candidate will lead and supervise a team of professional staff to implement Residential Care Services in St Luke's Region. The position will have a strong focus on supporting House Coordinators to provide high quality care, within  the DHHS Looking After Children Framework. Our Team Leader will have a passion for quality improvement, and a dedication to meeting and exceeding standards of care, as a compassionate and trauma-informed practitioner. 

To be successful in the position you will need:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Social Work or an appropriate equivalent;
  • Demonstrated experience and competence in the Human Services field, including experience working with children and young people, preferably in residential settings;
  • Experience in managing and leading a client-focussed team;
  • Ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team and multi-faceted service, and
  • Outstanding communication skills, with a high-level of written and reporting experience.

Detailed Position Description: PD - Team Leader - Residential Care - Ongoing Full Time - St Luke's - June 2018.pdf

We encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People.

112078.title: Product Communications Consultant
112078.summary: We’re growing and we have a fantastic opportunity for a Product Communications Consultant to join our talented team.
112078.description:
We’re growing and we have a fantastic opportunity for a Product Communications Consultant to join our talented team. You’ll help deliver high quality and customer-driven communications for our customers, financial advisers, employers and shareholders.

Australian Ethical is Australia’s leading ethical fund manager. We deliver competitive financial performance to our clients and positive change to society and the environment. Since we started in 1986, our Ethical Charter has guided all investment decisions and underpinned our business practices. Ten per cent of our profits are distributed to charitable organisations and social impact initiatives through The Australian Ethical Foundation.

Our mission is to grow the good and deliver sustainable growth. This means that we operate in a way that is conscious of the impact on the world around us while remaining competitive. And people like what we do. We have more than 118,000 followers on social media, in 2017, we were Australia’s fastest growing super fund, and in 2018 have more than $2.6 billion in funds under management and more than 35,000 members and investors.

What you’ll do:

  • Develop sales collateral to support the sales and client services teams
  • Develop a range of communication covering product-related and technical aspects of superannuation, insurance and managed funds
  • Develop technical collateral to support the compliant delivery of our products
  • Manage the internal sign-off processes
  • Work with internal stakeholders to coordinate award submissions and ratings processes to support our public profile
  • Provide back-up to Head of Communications on media management and corporate communication

Who we’re looking for:

Must have:

  • 5 years+ experience working in a super fund, investment manager or financial services communication agency
  • Detailed understanding of the technical aspects of superannuation, insurance and investments
  • Superb writing skills and the ability to take complex information and make it clear and engaging
  • Demonstrated client, project and production management experience across a range of communication programs and vehicles (digital and traditional media)
  • Strong time management and organisational skills with an eye for detail
  • Degree qualified in communications, marketing or PR

Nice to have:

  • ASIC RG146 or Diploma of Financial Services

We have a collaborative and inspiring culture. Our people are purpose driven and have a strong connection to who we are and what we do. Here’s what we’re looking for when selecting the right candidate:

Empathy: Respectful, compassionate and collaborative. We listen to each other, express gratitude and build trusted relationships while being conscious of our impact on the world around us. 

Wisdom: We’re deep thinkers who bring about profound change. We value lifelong growth and are balanced in our approach.   

Authenticity: We bring our whole selves to work. We value individuality and we respect our purpose.  

Action: No change is achieved without action. We get on and do acting as a proof point for how business should be, aiming to lead and inspire others.    

Benefits:

  • Certified B Corp. We were recognised as one of the ‘Best in the World companies of 2017’ by B Lab
  • Our recently refurbished office is close to Pitt Street Mall and transport and is a well-lit, green workspace, full of plants, with repurposed furniture, recycled materials, living green wall and bamboo sit-to-stand desks
  • We have a wellbeing program which includes healthy, organic snacks each week, mediation, yoga and boxing classes and a table tennis table which lifts the heart-rate and encourages much inter-team friendly rivalry
  • Free travel insurance for you and your family
  • Purpose aligned volunteer days annually
  • Flexible work arrangements, including generous annual and parental leave policy
  • Training and development opportunities

112073.title: Family Violence Case Worker
112073.summary: If you like to be part of an organisation that strives in strengthening the safety and wellbeing and cultural connectedness of Aboriginal children, individuals and families, we want to hear from you.
112073.description:
• Position: Full - time position
  • Location: Preston
  • Salary: $58,000-$69,000

The opportunity

The Family Violence Case Worker provides holistic case management to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women and their children who are experiencing family violence in the Western Melbourne and Brimbank Melton areas. This position will build positive relationships and networks with relevant Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal organisations and services to ensure that appropriate referrals and supports are put in place.

The position will carry an allocated caseload of clients providing short and medium-term outreach and case management support.

About us

Victorian Aboriginal Child Care Agency (VACCA) operates within the context that Aboriginal children continue to be significantly over-represented in the protection and care system within Victoria. VACCA considers that it has the responsibility and the opportunity to promote, advocate for and achieve positive changes in the lives of Aboriginal children, their families and the broader Aboriginal community.

If you like to be part of an Organization that strives in strengthening the safety and wellbeing and cultural connectedness of Aboriginal children, individuals and families in their community, we want to hear from you

To be considered for this role you must demonstrate

  • Demonstrated understanding of historical and contemporary issues that affect Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in Australian society.
  • Experience and ability to work with Aboriginal organisations and communities and a proven ability to effectively communicate with Aboriginal people.
  • An awareness of family violence issues and the impacts on women children and families.
  • The ability to apply a flexible, non-judgmental and empowering approach to service delivery.
  • Knowledge of local family violence programs, accommodation, legal, health and community services within the region - or the ability to acquire that knowledge.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

112053.title: Victoria State Manager
112053.summary: The Victoria State Manager will set the strategic direction and lead the delivery and implementation of the Leadership Development Program in Victoria.
112053.description:
About Teach For Australia

Teach For Australia (TFA) is an innovative non-profit organisation and part of a global movement dedicated to developing leadership in classrooms and communities, to ensure all children achieve their potential.

We recruit Australia’s future leaders and inspire, connect and empower them to a lifetime of action tackling educational disadvantage – activated by the classroom. Our vision is of an Australia where all children, regardless background, attain an excellent education.

About the Program Operations Team

In support of the organisation’s growth and impact priorities, the team leads the delivery and implementation of the Leadership Development Program (LDP) in each partner State and Territory.

About the Position

The Victoria State Manager will set the strategic direction and lead the delivery and implementation of the Leadership Development Program in Victoria.

About You

You are committed to addressing educational inequity. You have extensive experience in building and managing relationships and networks, which is enabled by your ability to communicate effectively. You are confident in setting strategic direction and through your people leadership experience, you influence and motivate others to achieve a common goal. You are organised, adaptive and able to operate in an environment of competing needs and fluid timelines, and ideally, you will have experience in the Australian school system.

112049.title: Specialist Employment Advisor
112049.summary: Make change in the lives of others by creating pathways to employment for people in the community!
112049.description:
• Make the switch to an innovative leading employment service
  • Opportunities for career progression and success in a growing business
  • Competitive remuneration and employee benefits including Salary Packaging

Who are we?

Olympus Solutions is the employment division of Ability Options. We are a leading provider of Employment Services in Metropolitan Sydney and the Central Coast.

We partner with a range of community organisations to provide employment related services to their customers.

This has opened up opportunities for passionate, results driven individuals who value making a difference in the lives of people in the community through employment.

The Role

Our specialised employment services are required by the customers of one of Australia’s most well established Community Housing Providers.

This partnership has been developed to support people living in Community Housing to access vocational services.

As a Specialist Employment Advisor your role will be to focus on the placement of Community Housing tenants into sustainable, ongoing employment.

You will do this through facilitating workshops, reverse marketing and the creation of strong employer links. You will work closely with the Community Housing team to provide suitable interventions targeted at gaining and sustaining employment.

You will assist participants through the entire life cycle of Employment Services, starting from Employment Assistance through to Post-Placement Support.

The role will require travel across the Greater Western Sydney area.

Ideally you will:

  • Have experience in Employment Services, particularly Disability Employment Services.
  • Have demonstrated experience facilitating workshops/training.
  • Have proven results working in an outcomes based role
  • Have strong marketing, and cold-calling experience to build employer links and source vacancies for your participants
  • Understand the challenges faced by people when seeking employment and be able tailor job seeking to the individual's particular challenges and employment goals
  • Be optimistic, have a positive outlook and be prepared to give people a go
  • Be able to work independently within a different workplace culture
  • Be clear in your responsibility to deliver the employment component of the integrated service with the mental health
  • Have a NSW drivers licence (P2 or above) and own vehicle that is comprehensively insured.

If you are passionate about working with Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander communities you are encouraged to apply.

Why Work for Us?

Our innovative service delivery model is driven by our commitment to ensure all people have the right support to find a job they love that makes a meaningful contribution to their community.

Olympus Solutions | Ability Options is committed to a workplace culture that recognises diversity, equity and human rights. We respect and value the contribution of people from all cultures, backgrounds and lifestyles. Ability options is a White Ribbon accredited workplace.

112041.title: Active Night / Stand Up Residential Care Worker
112041.summary: Ongoing, part time (63 hours per Fortnight) opportunity available within our specialised home where you can make a difference in the lives of disadvantaged children.
112041.description:
About the role

In this rewarding role, as a Residential Care Worker you will work collaboratively to provide a high standard of physical and emotional care to young people living within our homes. By utilising your passion and commitment, you will interact therapeutically and positively with the young people, spending quality time with them, cooking meals, undertaking household duties and participating in daily general duties. In this position, you will also provide information to other professionals regarding the young people, as well as completing reports, updating records and other compliance requirements.

We are currently seeking a new addition to join our motivated team on an ongoing part-time basis. This role will be based in the Southern Metro region.

Typical shift times of a stand up Residential Care Worker, held on any day of the week, are:

  • 10:30pm – 7:30am; or
  • 11pm – 8am

Our homes operate on a 24/7 basis, thus successful applicants must be available to work a roster including evenings, overnights, weekends and public holidays.

About you

We are looking for people who have:

  • Certificate IV in Child, Youth and Family Intervention (Residential and Out of Home Care), or other similar or relevant tertiary qualifications;
  • A commitment towards the principles and practice of quality care in residential settings for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged young people, and to promote autonomy and self-determination for clients;
  • Demonstrated understanding of, and respect for, cultural and linguistic diversity (CALD), including cultural safety for children from CALD backgrounds;
  • Excellent communication skills, including abilities in engaging well with young people and working collaboratively with other staff and professionals; and
  • Flexibility in working hours – particularly night shifts.

This is a fantastic opportunity to build upon your current experience while working within a specialised environment. This position also offers a great team environment as part of an evolving, values-driven organisation.

MacKillop is committed to being a child safe organisation. Applicants will be required to undergo psychometric testing, a national criminal record checks and have an employment working with children check.

112024.title: Family Services Practitioner
112024.summary: Bring your Social Work expertise & experience to energetic team working with vulnerable children & their families. Full time position in Croydon.
112024.description:
Passion: Work that you can see making a difference with your clients

Balance: Full time, flexibility available, small teams

Growth: Large agency focused on staff development & internal opportunities

  • Stimulating Social Work role
  • Support parenting & family functioning
  • Vibrant team and supportive leadership
  • Full time - regular hours - 9 to 5
  • Maximum term - to mid 2020
  • Options for extensions or transfer within Uniting
  • More take home pay using salary packaging
  • Office location - Croydon
  • Connections – now part of Uniting

About Uniting

At Uniting we are passionate about working together to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice.   

We are proud to have been part of local communities for over 100 years delivering services across Victoria and Tasmania. With a team of 7,000 skilled and committed individuals we provide over 770 programs and services to people of all ages to learn, thrive and enjoy a healthy, happy life.

We’re there for children, families, people with disability, older people and those experiencing homelessness, mental illness or drug and alcohol addiction.

Uniting is looking for great people who, like us, celebrate diversity and welcome everyone regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity. 

Learn more

vt.uniting.org

About the opportunity

We have exciting opportunities for Family Services Practitioners to join us based in Croydon, due to extended funding. 

The Integrated Family Services program:

  • Aims to support families who are experiencing high levels of stress and difficulties that impact on parenting, family life and children’s well being
  • Respond to referrals from Child FIRST
  • Provides home based supports through assertive outreach

In a typical day, a Family Services Practitioner might:

  • Use a creative approach to arrange a visit with a reluctant new family
  • Build rapport to carry out a strengths and risk assessment in the client’s home or child’s school
  • Review with your supervisor plans to support a family’s goals
  • Consult with an internal Family Violence specialist on resources for the needs of a child you are working with
  • Finalise case notes and prepare a report for other agencies that you are working with on a complex case
  • Celebrate with a client the achievement of a goal
  • Discuss a difficult case with your team members in a Reflective Practice meeting 

Connections offers employees:

  • A comprehensive range of professional development opportunities
  • Supportive and regular supervision
  • Career options through a wide range of programs and locations across Uniting
  • Salary packaging up to $15,900 per annum via Paywise salary packaging (www.paywise.com.au). 

About you  

To be successful in your application you will meet the person specification in the position description, including having a relevant tertiary qualification in a field related to Social Work or Psychology. 

Please provide responses online to the following questions related to the person specification:

  • List your tertiary level qualifications in Social Work, Psychology or a related field
  • Summarise your knowledge and experience within the child and family services, and child protection systems in Victoria, including the use of the Child, Youth and Families Act 2005, and the Best Interest Principles
  • Describe a challenging time you had in actively engaging with a family
  • Describe an intervention related to the development of parenting capacity, that you planned and implemented

Get in touch

  • Angela Geylswyk - Program Leader (03) 9875 4222 

Employment is subject to satisfactory criminal history and Victorian Working with Children Checks prior to commencement. Uniting is proud to be an inclusive employer and committed to keeping children safe.

The role

Central Clinic is looking for a registered Nurse with General Practice experience to provide holistic care to all patients. In this diverse position, the ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to prioritise tasks and also display effective organisational skills. They will also have comprehensive experience of developing Chronic Disease Management Programs.

Essential criteria

Incentives 

(https://www.ntphn.org.au/grants)

For further information regarding these opportunities, contact a NT PHN Senior Recruitment Coordinator.

The location

Central Australia

Famously known for Uluru, the Red Centre region of Central Australia is a desert environment with mainly dry hot summers and cool dry winters. The area draws tourist interest due to the town of Alice Springs and the impressive natural attractions in the area such as Palm Valley National Park, the West MacDonnell Ranges, the Finke Gorge and popular events such as the Camel Cup. ‘The Alice’ is the second largest town in the Territory with more than 25.000 people calling it home. The town has all the amenities one needs, with shopping malls, schools and recreational activities available.

Great Careers Start Right Here!

A unique opportunity exists to work for an Indigenous policy & leadership reform organisation dedicated to empowering Cape York Indigenous People.

111857.title: Workplace Health and Safety Trainer
111857.summary: Unions Tasmania is looking for a WHS Trainer to deliver training courses for HSRs under the Tasmanian Work Health and Safety Act 2012 as well as under the Federal Work Health and Safety Act 2011.
111857.description:
• Position Title Workplace Health and Safety (WHS) Trainer 
  • Position Location: Hobart 
  • Employment Type: Fixed term, 12 months (part-time)                                                               
  • Classification: Level 7, Unions Tasmania Staff Agreement, $76,301K + 16.5% superannuation
  • Reports to: Secretary

About Unions Tasmania 

Unions Tasmania is the peak body for trade unions in Tasmania. It is also the Tasmanian branch of the Australian Council of Trade Unions (ACTU). With 26 affiliated unions across the state, Unions Tasmania represents approximately 50,000 union members. 

The Tasmanian union movement works every day to build a better society for everyone. We campaign in workplaces, in the community and in the public and political arena to affect change that raises the living standards of workers and their families. 

We also have a strong focus on workplace health and safety. We provide training to elected health and safety representatives (HSRs) across industry, in the private and public sector. We are approved by WorkSafe Tasmania and Comcare to deliver training to HSRs but we also tailor courses to suit the needs of employers by training members of health and safety committees and managers.

Overview 

Unions Tasmania is looking for WHS Trainer to deliver introductory and refresher training courses for HSRs exercising powers and functions under the Tasmanian Work Health and Safety Act 2012 as well as under the Federal Work Health and Safety Act 2011. 

The WHS Trainer would also be responsible for increasing participation and building attendance at courses so the role will also have a focus on relationship building, stake holder engagement, planning and strategising.

Most training is delivered out of the Unions Tasmania office in Hobart, however, some travel may be required to conduct a course in Launceston or Devonport. Currently, training requirements total 8 weeks of course delivery per annum with time spent promoting and building courses negotiable. The ability to increase working hours exists dependent upon the success of course promotion. 

This is a part time, fixed term role, totally 59 days in a twelve-month period. Training courses run for either 1, 2, 3 or 5 days. There is flexibility around days and hours of work. For the right person who can help us build and grow our training services, there is potential to grow this role to include more hours with the possibility of turning it into a full-time role. 

Essential Requirements

  • Demonstrated commitment to trade unionism and social justice;
  • A minimum Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (or equivalent);
  • A minimum of two years relevant experience working in an occupational or health and safety role or relevant tertiary qualifications in a field directly related to occupational or work health and safety;
  • Broad knowledge of WHS and Workers Compensation legislation;
  • Strong verbal communication and presentation skills; and
  • A current Driver’s License.

 Desirable 

  • Experience either working for, or being active within, a trade union;
  • Experience in building relationships and stakeholder engagement.

A full Position Description is attached below.
